In fact, I seriously don't know how the producer got the money to create this movie with such polish (then again, this is a Canadian film, so I'm sure they got a public grant for their required quota of gay films per year). If you have an hour to kill, watch this movie with a remote control so you can fast-forward through the slow parts...you'll need it.

2860.name: Hotel
2860.storyline: Rosa Waissnix is not a professional actress, she actually runs the hotel where the film was shot. Director Jessica Hausner convinced her to take over a part in her film.

2861.name: The Midnight Man
2861.storyline: During the movie, Kelly mentions how the Midnight Man sounds like a "Creepypasta" story. The legend of the Midnight Man and his game is in fact a story created on Creepypasta.

2862.name: The Forbidden Room
2862.storyline: Each sequence of The Forbidden Room is based on reviews and summaries of "lost" films, mostly from America in the early to mid-20th century. These films were destroyed intentionally or by natural degradation of the original film stock, and will likely never be seen again. Guy Maddin realized the only way he'd be able to see these lost movies was to make them himself.

2863.name: The Book of Revelation
2863.storyline: Anna Torv plays both Daniel's girlfriend Bridget, and one of his female captors. Director Ana Kokkinos advises this was done purely because Anna Torv was the best available person for both roles, rather than the character of Bridget secretly being one of Daniel's captors.

2864.name: Lady in the Lake
2864.storyline: Lloyd Nolan was almost blinded when the glass splinters from a bullet that smashed a window hit him in the face. He was rushed to the hospital and a doctor carefully removed a shard of glass from the edge of his cornea.

2865.name: Sparkling Cyanide
2865.storyline: Oliver Ford Davies and Roger Frost also starred together in the ITV Poirot adaptation of The Murder of Roger Ackroyd.

2866.name: Dr. Bird's Advice for Sad Poets
2866.storyline: Ale Kino! International Young Audience Film Festival - Poland

2868.name: Lupin III: The First
2868.storyline: The film is dedicated to Monkey Punch, the creator of Lupin III, who died in April 2019, six months before the film released.

2869.name: Autopsy
2869.storyline: Second movie to star both Robert Patrick and Jenette Goldstein. The first being Terminator 2: Judgment Day (1991).

2870.name: Assassination of a High School President
2870.storyline: Although the location is never clearly stated, Principal Kirkpatrick, played by Bruce Willis, has the state flag of New Jersey in his office. Willis grew up in Penns Grove, New Jersey.

2871.name: Hit: The First Case
2871.storyline: This is a remake of Telugu film by the same name

2872.name: Ring 2
2872.storyline: Ringu (1998) and Spiral (1998) were shot back-to-back from the novels by Koji Suzuki and released in theaters as a double bill. After audiences hated The Spiral, Asmik Ace Entertainment hired the cast and crew of the original to make this replacement sequel Ring 2.

2873.name: A Zest for Death: A Hannah Swensen Mystery
2873.storyline: The first of the "Hannah Swensen" movies to feature all three Swensen sisters.

2874.name: Blue Eyes of the Broken Doll
2874.storyline: The UK pre-cert Canon video was regularly seized by police during the 1980s' "video nasty" scare and wrongly listed by "Video World" magazine as one of the official DPP 74 nasties.

2876.name: Double Life
2876.storyline: I sat down to watch the 2023 crime thriller "Double Life" after having read the synopsis and found it to be somewhat interesting. I hadn't heard about the movie prior to sitting down to watch it though.Writers Michael Hurst and Chris Sivertson put together an amazingly generic, montonous and slow paced narrative for director Martin Wood to bring to the screen. The storyline in "Double Life" was so slow paced that it was a struggle to sit through it, and the fact that nothing interesting happened, just made it even more mind-numbing to sit through the ordeal. The concept of the storyline sounded interesting, for sure, but the execution from script to screen was just horrible.I wasn't familiar with the cast ensemble in "Double Life", aside from actor Niall Matter, and he was hardly even in the movie. The actresses and actors in the movie, however, had very little contents to work with and bring to the script in terms of script, storyline, characters and dialogue.If you enjoy crime thrillers, then do yourself a favor and don't waste 89 minutes on the generic movie that is named "Double Life". There are far better crime thrillers out there.My rating of "Double Life" lands on a three out of ten stars.

2877.name: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
2877.storyline: Based on an 1899 stage play by William Gillette which--famously--was the stage debut of Charles Chaplin, playing the character of Billy. Terry Kilburn plays the character in the film.

2880.name: The Black Castle
2880.storyline: Lon Chaney Jr's last horror film for Universal.

2881.name: Night Train
2881.storyline: The character names of Gutman (Constantine Gregory) and Cairo (Jo Marr) are direct homages to those played by Sydney Greenstreet and Peter Lorre in The Maltese Falcon (1941).

2882.name: Sukkubus
2882.storyline: Version of Sennentuntschi: Curse of the Alps (2010)

2883.name: 7 Faces of Dr. Lao
2883.storyline: Tony Randall shaved his head for the role of Dr. Lao. It also made it easier to apply the make-up for the different characters he played. The studio publicity department wanted to photograph Randall getting his head shaved but arrived at the barber too late. They had the make-up artist glue hair back on Randall's head so Randall could pose for photos while getting the hair cut off again.

2884.name: The Honey Pot
2884.storyline: The great Italian cinematographer Gianni Di Venanzo died suddenly of hepatitis (aged only 45) during the making of this movie, with many weeks of the five-month shooting schedule to go before completion. His operator, Pasqualino De Santis, took over as director of photography, but refused credit in this capacity, although he would quickly go on to international renown with his work for Luchino Visconti, Franco Zeffirelli, Joseph Losey, and others.

2885.name: Twin Murders: The Silence of the White City
2885.storyline: Based on the bestseller of the same name by Eva García Sáenz de Urturi.

2886.name: Ela Veezha Poonchira
2886.storyline: It's essentially a ⭐⭐⭐ movie but an extra ½ to the makers (especially, director Shahi Kabir) for creating a fascinatingly little but intense atmosphere. The wireless station where the story takes place is said to be at an altitude of over 3,200 feet. Writers (Shaji Marad, Nidhish G) place the two leads (Soubin Shahir & Sudhi Koppa) at the top of a hill that's notorious for its deaths by lightning strikes. The first half is leisurely paced, giving us some incredible views of the surroundings, a few visitors, and the two cops' daily routines (that include eating, drinking, playing cards, and updating statuses through a wireless system).I'm a big fan of minimalist setups and fewer characters in stories, especially because they often prove to be intricate character studies from a psychological perspective. At 100 minutes, the writing is also tasked with the responsibility of including a murder investigation which begins as a sub-plot but slowly turns into an integral component. Therefore, the latter half is focused around making the twists, turns, and mind games work. They largely do, and credit for that should go to the performances from both Soubin and Sudhi. Once the uneasiness sets in, the film tightly holds onto it all the way to the finish. The weather elements (sudden winds, fogging, rains, lightning) also add an essential layer.The sound design (Ajayan Adat), cinematography (Manesh Madhavan), and background score (Anil Johnson) truly make the experience unmissable. The only issue I felt is that some of the dialogues in the climactic portion get drowned out by the score/noise. Nonetheless, the film is a triumph in the storytelling, performances, and atmosphere-building departments.

2887.name: Sisters
2887.storyline: This film is a remake of Sisters (1973).

2888.name: The Giant
2888.storyline: Charlotte: Lauren, what happened to your clothes?Lauren: Who are all these people? I don't know these people.Charlotte: Of course you do, honey. They're our friends.Lauren: You don't know these people. These moths.

2889.name: Sightless
2889.storyline: Madelaine Petsch and Matthew Yang King have both appeared in Riverdale.

2890.name: Double Door
2890.storyline: Only film role of Mary Morris, despite drawing rave reviews from critics at the time. Morris was in her late 30s when she made this film, and seems to have made a career playing older women on the stage.

2891.name: Night Killer
2891.storyline: Claudio Fragasso envisioned the film as a tense psychological thriller with little to no gore. The original cut of the film resembled his vision, but the producers were not happy with the cut that Fragasso turned in, feeling that it lacked violence, so Bruno Mattei was tasked with shooting additional scenes to add more gore into the film.

2892.name: Campton Manor
2892.storyline: This movie had a descent premise, but boy, did it not deliver.The acting is terrible, the plot is all over the place, and most of the "twists" are easy enough to guess.By the time the few details that I did not guess were revealed, I no longer cared.The best part of this movie is the jump scare in the beginning with that hand reaching out over the desk.That hand leads you to believe this will be a much better movie than it is.Even the ambiguous time period ( I honestly didn't even realize it wasn't current til I noticed the men were wearing hats with their suits) this movie seems to be set in just added to the over all muddled feel of it.Definitely skip this one!

2893.name: Who Saw Her Die?
2893.storyline: George Lazenby lost 35 pounds for this role.

2895.name: Once Upon a Crime
2895.storyline: I admitted that I didn't finish the movie. There might be some interesting plot twists waiting ahead, but I felt from the beginning that it looks like fantasy that looks like a farce in costume, or a comedy that isn't even funny. The voice and action of the witch character was extremely annoying. Cinderella and red-hood girl exchanged some boring scripts. Then another annoying character popped up, looking like an angel or something. I couldn't stand watching it anymore. It's boring and isn't funny or interesting in anyway. The costume looks fancy alright but that doesn't enough to get me through. So I just write my experience and opinion as being from someone who couldn't manage to watch this movie to the end.

2896.name: The Beast with Five Fingers
2896.storyline: The piece of piano music played by Francis Ingram (Victor Francen) and later, his disembodied left hand, is the "Bach Chaconne in D Minor," as arranged to be played by the left hand alone by Johannes Brahms. It was selected by Max Steiner because the story required a piece of music that could be performed by a pianist with only his left hand, and Steiner, who was born in Vienna and whose family were friendly with Brahms, rather than composing his own original piece, immediately recognized its potential in underscoring such a grim tale. Legendary Hungarian-American pianist Ervin Nyiregyhazi performed the music played by the severed hand.

2897.name: Siesta
2897.storyline: Director Mary Lambert asked Madonna to star in this film, but she declined because the film had "too much nudity and sexual content".

2898.name: My Cousin Rachel
2898.storyline: Richard Burton's posthumously-published diaries reveal that he accepted the role of Philip in this film because it was being planned as a comeback vehicle for Greta Garbo under the direction of his friend George Cukor, whom he regarded as one of the great Hollywood directors. He claims that Garbo personally told him she would only do the film with him as her leading man. After negotiations with both Garbo and Cukor fell through (Garbo never made another film, and Cukor was replaced by Henry Koster and he and Burton never worked together), Burton remained attached to the project, which was re-fashioned as a vehicle for Olivia de Havilland. Burton claims that de Havilland was impossibly arrogant following her recent Oscar win for The Heiress (1949), insisted on having sole above-the-title billing, and would not allow anyone to address her by her first name, only by "Miss de Havilland". He found this state of affairs preposterous and was rude about her for the rest of his life whenever the film (which he also disliked) came up in interviews.

2900.name: The Dark Side of the Moon
2900.storyline: Joe Turkel's character wears far-sighted eyeglasses which are unusually large in frame, and make his eyes look bigger than they actually are, just like his character in Blade Runner (1982).

2901.name: The Red Queen Kills Seven Times
2901.storyline: Though the film was co-produced by a West German production company and mostly shot in West Germany, it was never released theatrically there. Instead, it premiered straight to home video in the late 1980s.

2902.name: Take Me
2902.storyline: Ray's former clients on the Polaroid board include actor/comedian Josh Fadem ("Bar Mitzvah Nightmare"), Se7en screenwriter Andrew Kevin Walker ("Shock Corridor"), the film's producers Mel Eslyn ("Nobody Likes a Gossip") and Sev Ohanian ("Dirty Diaper"), and various other members of the crew.

2903.name: The After
2903.storyline: Not actually a TV movie, but a pilot made for Amazon that was not picked up to series even though 8 additional episodes were originally ordered but later canceled due to creative differences between the showrunner Chris Carter and the Amazon studio.

2904.name: Private Parts
2904.storyline: Cheryl (Ayn Ruymen) yells "Alice doesn't live here anymore!," two years before, when the completely unrelated movie Alice Doesn't Live Here Anymore (1974) was released.

2905.name: Jagga Jasoos
2905.storyline: There are 29 songs in this film.

2906.name: Character
2906.storyline: Although the story takes place in the Dutch city of Rotterdam, many scenes were filmed in other cities across The Netherlands and Europe. This was because Rotterdam has very few buildings from this era left following heavy bombing during the Second World War. Filming locations included: Hamburg (Germany), Wroclaw (Poland), Antwerp and Ghent (Belgium) and The Hague (The Netherlands).

2907.name: Black Tide
2907.storyline: This is the adaptation of Dror Mishani's novel "A disturbing disappearance" (Tik Ne'edar).

2908.name: The Evil Next Door
2908.storyline: [repeated line] Ghost kid: Please, help me.

2909.name: A Beautiful Place to Die: A Martha's Vineyard Mystery
2909.storyline: The aerial shot at 1:16 into the movie is Menemsha Basin in Martha's Vineyard.

2910.name: Creepy
2910.storyline: The serial killer that the main character discusses with his class is Robert Hansen. He would kidnap prostitutes and take them in his plane into the forest where he would hunt them down and kill them. He lived in Alaska.

2911.name: Mama 2
2911.storyline: Project notes, plot, and industry news

2912.name: Artemis
2912.storyline: Based on the novel of the same name by Andy Weir (The Martian)

2913.name: Trick
2913.storyline: Outside the movie theater, Talbott gives Troy a mask and tells him that all of the kids get one. This is an inside joke to Halloween 3 : Season of the Witch, in which Tom Atkins, who plays Talbott, starred as the protagonist. Halloween 3's story line revolved around Halloween masks that would kill the children wearing them.

2914.name: The Lego Star Wars Holiday Special
2914.storyline: Premiered on Disney+ on the same date (17 November) that the original The Star Wars Holiday Special (1978) was broadcast on CBS 42 years earlier.

2915.name: Distorted
2915.storyline: The scene at the Orion Hotel at the end of the movie was an actual abandoned winery hotel found by the location manager / crew.

2916.name: Body of Deceit
2916.storyline: Featured in Skin: A History of Nudity in the Movies (2020)

2917.name: Malina
2917.storyline: Featured in Mondo Lux - Die Bilderwelten des Werner Schroeter (2011)

2918.name: Satan's Slaves 2: Communion
2918.storyline: This film is the first Southeast Asian film which will release in IMAX format.

2919.name: Nothing But the Night
2919.storyline: This was the only movie produced by "Charlemagne Films," which was created by Sir Christopher Lee and Anthony Nelson Keys.

2920.name: Murder Most Foul
2920.storyline: Miss Jane Marple's audition piece for the Cosgood Players is her dramatic rendering of "The Shooting of Dan McGrew", a 1907 poem by Robert W. Service. Dame Margaret Rutherford was especially fond of the piece and reportedly once intended to give a reading of it at a women's prison to cheer up the inmates.

2921.name: Passion of Mind
2921.storyline: Many fans consider this to be Demi Moore's best movie. Critics unjustifiably dismissed it because her offscreen persona is not well-liked. The reviews on Amazon, however, are overwhelmingly positive.

2922.name: St. Ives
2922.storyline: The lobby of the Hotel Lido, where Ray St. Ives lives, may look familiar to Eagles fans. It was the location for the gatefold photo of their "Hotel California" album, released in December 1976.

2923.name: Teach Me Tonight
2923.storyline: Frankie: Not you, I don't think you're gonna have a big enough sized tool for the job.

2924.name: Smoke Screen
2924.storyline: "Smoke Screen" is a Lifetime TV movie from 2010 starring Jaime Pressly, Currie Graham, Garwin Sanford, and Larissa Laskin. Writing that it's a Lifetime movie and then adding it was made in Canada is redundant, but there you go.Pressly is Britt Shelley, a beautiful blond news reporter. One morning she wakes up and there's a dead man in bed with her. Naturally the police suspect her immediately, and poor Britt can't remember a thing past a certain point. She's positive she was slipped a date rape drug. She explains to the police detectives that a man who was involved in a fire she covered five years ago, Jay (Martin Cummins) wanted to speak with her. They meet at a restaurant; he has something important to tell her. After that, she's clueless until she wakes up next to his dead body.A city firefighter whose career was ruined by Britt due to the incident five years earlier, Raley (Currie Graham) kidnaps her and takes her to his cabin. Raley points out that he was set up the exact same way as Britt: he woke up with a woman in his bed, and the last thing he remembered was her offering him a drink at a party. The two investigate and realize the two cases are connected, and that someone is out to get Britt.This film didn't hold together all that well, and I figured out whodunit pretty soon after it started. It's a little slow, the romance seemed implausible, and Currie Graham was a distraction because he reminded me so much of Kevin Spacey. I actually thought there were too many characters and different parts of the original crime didn't come together well; if it had been directed better, we could have seen the plots gel more succinctly, but as it was, it was all over the place.Jaime Pressly did an okay job; she looks like your ideal soap opera actress, and the rest of the acting was passable. Just an okay film. Writing okay and Lifetime movie is redundant. But there you go.

2925.name: A Killer Within
2925.storyline: The luxurious homes that the main characters lived in were actually full-furnished show houses in North Dallas.

2926.name: The Gore Gore Girls
2926.storyline: This was the only movie Herschell Gordon Lewis submitted to the MPAA; they gave it an X rating.

2927.name: The Night Listener
2927.storyline: At 5 minutes and 58 seconds into the film, Armistead Maupin's real-life husband Christopher Turner appears, playing the part of Jess's (Bobby Cannavale) friend whom Gabriel (Robin Williams) facetiously refers to as "Lucifer." Jess corrects him and says, "Lucien. He's just a friend."

2928.name: The Oxford Murders
2928.storyline: The "Bormat's Last Theorem" that is solved in the movie, is a reference to Fermat's Last Theorem. Like Bormat's theorem in the movie, Fermat's theorem was widely considered to be (one of) the most difficult problems of the last three hundred years. It was solved fairly recently (in 1995 by Andrew Wiles). It was solved using elliptic curves, and the proof was first demonstrated at Cambridge. Like the proof of Bormat's theorem in the movie, the proving of Fermat's was a very big deal in the world of number theory.

2929.name: Making Contact
2929.storyline: Although the bulk of the film was shot in Germany, writer-director Roland Emmerich set it in the United States and shot it in English so that the film could be marketed worldwide.

2930.name: Immanence
2930.storyline: Michael Beach and Anthony Ruivivar co-starred as FDNY paramedics who worked together (and often did not get along) in Third Watch.

2931.name: Sam and Colby: The Legends of the Paranormal
2931.storyline: Will be the sixth official entry in the Sam and Colby Franchise.

2932.name: Schizo
2932.storyline: Lynne Frederick supplied some of her own wardrobe for this film due to its very low budget.

2933.name: Retribution
2933.storyline: Though it was not originally released as an official entry in the J-Horror Theater film series, the film is included as the fourth entry in the anthology series. Other films include Infection (2004), Premonition (2004), and Reincarnation (2006)

2935.name: Deceptions
2935.storyline: Due to Harry Hamlin's popularity at the time (thanks to L.A. Law), the movie received a theatrical release in Europe and Australia.

2936.name: Shimmer Lake
2936.storyline: The original screenplay was on the 2009 Black List, a list of the "most liked" unmade scripts in Hollywood.

2937.name: Framed
2937.storyline: This film was made in 1947 when the House Un-American Activites Committee began its investigation of communism in Hollywood. Three of the people involved in this film, the screenwriter Ben Maddow, the actors Karen Morley and Art Smith were eventually blacklisted.

2938.name: Dark Waters
2938.storyline: Elizabeth is travelling to the monastery on a bonneted PAZ-651 minibus.

2939.name: Sheriff
2939.storyline: First film to use newly renovated Astro Studio's after takeover by Astro.

2940.name: Muse
2940.storyline: When Christopher Lloyd's character is mentioned in the movie, it is said that he started teaching in Brown. Brown was the last name of his most remembered character: Dr Emmett Brown in Back to the Future. The fact that Brown University in New England is an Ivy League college is completely irrelevant.

2941.name: Twice-Told Tales
2941.storyline: Beverly Garland claimed that she saw Vincent Price--who was a connoisseur of fine art, sculpture and furniture, among other things--eying some of the prop furniture on the set of the film. When the shooting ended, those pieces of furniture "mysteriously" vanished.

2942.name: Another Me
2942.storyline: Isabel Coixet revealed in an interview that Jonathan Rhys Meyers was extremely difficult to work with. She stated that he was the one person she would never work with again, that they had difficulty communicating and that she ran out of patience for him as he made work unpleasant for everyone on set.

2943.name: Design for Living
2943.storyline: Considerable censorship difficulties arose because of sexual discussions and innuendos, although the Hays Office eventually approved the film for release. However, the film was banned by the Legion of Decency and was refused a certificate for re-release by censor Joseph Breen in 1934 when the Production Code was more rigorously enforced.

2944.name: The Phoenix Incident
2944.storyline:
During production of the movie, the film makers were contacted by the U.S. Department of Justice regarding one of the film's viral websites. Due to the perceived authenticity of the site, the DOJ threatened imprisonment and substantial federal fines, believing the website infringed on the department's likeness to locate the missing men from the film.
After several tense days of legal negotiation between the production's attorneys and the Justice Department, the site was reinstated and continues to serve the motion picture.

2946.name: Two
2946.storyline: Sara: He doesn't like it when we kiss.

2947.name: Dark Encounter
2947.storyline: Although the movie establishes that the events happen in Blue Hill County, Pennsylvania, actually the movie was filmed in North Yorkshire, England. In real-life Blue Hill is a summit close to Susquehanna River in Northumberland County, Pennsylvania, having 17821 as ZIP Code delivery area.

2948.name: The Good Student
2948.storyline: Hayden Panettiere plays a high school student as in the Heroes series.

2949.name: Slim Susie
2949.storyline: Some scenes were taken from director Ulf Malmros' own youth, like one where Erik decides to move to Stockholm because the film company forgot to send the last reel of Pulp Fiction (1994) to the local theatre. In real life it was E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial (1982) and the projectionist came down and told the ending of the movie.

2950.name: I'm Not Scared
2950.storyline: As the film is mainly told from a child's point of view, director Gabriele Salvatores instructed his director of photography Italo Petriccione to shoot most of the film at a child's height.

2951.name: Murder, She Wrote: The Celtic Riddle
2951.storyline: This is the fourth and last "Murder, She Wrote" Movie of the Week that CBS/Leslie Moonves negotiated with Peter Shaw and Dame Angela Lansbury, "Corymore Productions", fulfilling the negotiated settlement cancelling the popular series in 1996. The original Cabot Cove (Mendocino, California series location) never was considered for use as a basis of a story plot in any of the projected four Movie of the Week projects. Peter and Angela wished to close the series occurring in Ireland. During the twelve years of the CBS series, many story plots and scenarios had been set in Ireland. Set in Ireland, second unit filming always was organized to film establishing exterior buildings, landscapes, an automobile driving on country lanes with matching vehicles filmed in conjunction of the movie's local Los Angeles exteriors. This last project gave an excuse for Angela and Peter to film the Ireland inserted establishing shots after filming was completed at Universal Studios. After these exterior Ireland street establishing insert shots were completed, the editors completed and delivered the finished two hour special to CBS. Filmed during 2002, the last "Murder, She Wrote" aired in 2003, after Peter Shaw's death in January 29, 2003. This movie was dedicated as a memorial to Peter Shaw Pullen.

2952.name: Beyond Atlantis
2952.storyline: The film did not do well financially, something John Ashley chiefly attributed to the PG rating. "Had we done it a little harder it probably would have done better," said Ashley later. "At least we'd have had a picture that was a little more exploitable." He also thought that the extensive underwater footage slowed down the action, saying, "It's gorgeous. But watching it is like watching slow motion."

2953.name: A Quiet Place to Kill
2953.storyline: The first line of the title track "You" states "You represent everything I detest in a man." and then goes on to individually catalog these detestable qualities, pretty much summed up in the character Maurice. Appropriate then, that he should choose to put on the record as soon as he arrives at the hunting lodge, plotting Helen's death.

2954.name: The Killing Room
2954.storyline: Tony is wearing a Bayside Tigers T-shirt. The Bayside Tigers are the fictional high school football team in Saved By The Bell.

2955.name: The Husband's Secret
2955.storyline: Based on Liane Moriarty's 2013 novel of the same name.

2956.name: Ham on Rye
2956.storyline: The character Artie was not intended to be on crutches. When actor Sam Hernandez broke his femur a few months before filming began and showed up at Director Taormina's home on crutches, the Director liked the look so much he changed the script to include them, even though Hernandez's leg was completely healed by the film shoot.

2957.name: The Black Mass
2957.storyline: I watched it without knowing anything about the plot. I thought this is a "mindless fun" slasher movie. It's not. There is nothing enjoyable here, too bleak/sad/disturbing. This is how serial killer Ted Bundy spent a day of his life, having a psychotic break. There are positive things here, i mean, this movie takes you to a journey into Bundy's mind. Camera focuses on the victims, not him, but there is nothing voyeuristic here. It's just raw and real. This movie doesn't glorify serial killers as many other movies do. It shows you the truth, the ugliness, nothing charming here, it's a movie about the victims not the monsters. It made me uncomfortable to say the least. And i didn't like it, i was not ready for this. It looked more like a documentary or like a FOUND FOOTAGE than a "normal" movie. It gets a bit satisfying in the end, when it shows some shots from the actual Bundy trial. But overall, it was too disturbing for me.There is zero entertainment value here but if you find it interesting as it was described, you might like it more than me. It's a journey into the heart of darkness. I got goosebumbs when i realise what the title THE BLACK MASS actually means. It's not a sick movie like so many movies, it doesn't "idolize" serial killers and that's a good thing but still, if i knew what this is about, i would have never watched it.

2958.name: Lonely Castle in the Mirror
2958.storyline: Merry-Go-RoundPerformed by YuuriLyrics & Music by YuuriArranged by ChimerazCourtesy of Sone Music Records

2959.name: So Cold the River
2959.storyline: Pluto Water, a mineral water which is an important part of the story, actually exists in French Lick and West Baden. It was once bottled and sold around the country. However, due to modern knowledge, the water is no longer drank or bottled, as drinking it can cause sickness.

2960.name: Nabonga
2960.storyline: To play the role of Doreen as a child, director Sam Newfield used his own daughter, Jackie Newfield.

2961.name: Extra Terrestrial Visitors
2961.storyline: The film was originally intended as a low-budget horror movie about an evil alien. After the success of E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial (1982), the producers made the alien into a lovable character, and added a kid who befriends it. Director Juan Piquer Simón was not satisfied with the final result.

2962.name: Columbo: A Bird in the Hand
2962.storyline: The football footage, which shows two mock American football teams, is excerpted from an actual Canadian Football League game shot in Edmonton, Alberta, Canada between the Saskatchewan Roughriders and the Edmonton Eskimos.

2963.name: The Unseen Sister
2963.storyline: Base on the novel "Da Qiao Xiao Qiao" by Zhang Yueran.

2964.name: Dobaaraa
2964.storyline: Dobaaraa (English translation: "Again") is a homophone of Do Barah (English translation: "Two Twelve"). The title is stylized as DO BAARAA superimposed over 2:12.

2965.name: Raaz
2965.storyline: The remake of Hollywood film What lies beneath.

2966.name: A Guilty Conscience
2966.storyline: The first Hong Kong film to top HK$100m at local box office on 21 Feb, 2023.

2967.name: The Search for Secret Santa
2967.storyline: So, to begin with - I love ALL of these movies you guys make. And this one ESPECIALLY was heart warming. Beautiful - the story - the music - and especially the ACTING! SKYE COYNE was incredible as the lead - I would watch EVERY ONE of the movies she's in over and over again - she deserves to be in all of your movies. The charisma, reactions, and chemistry she shared, as the lead, with the rest of the cast was amazing. Her and Jackee's scenes were hilarious. Alex as the romantic lead was incredibly charismatic. I loved the twists and turns with his character as well. I thoroughly enjoyed this holiday movie. Thank you for making it!

2968.name: No Clue
2968.storyline: Cameo: Nancy Robertson, Brent Butt's wife and Corner Gas (2004) co-star.

2969.name: Innocence
2969.storyline: Pamela gives Beckett a dress by the designer Jill Stewart who is actually the father of Sophie Lane Curtis who plays Beckett.

2970.name: As You Are
2970.storyline: The song Mark is making fun of when he says "Jeremy!" is Jeremy by Pearl Jam.

2971.name: Dirty Teacher
2971.storyline: On Danny's phone, it shows up as an iMessage (an iPhone feature) but the teacher is using an Android phone, which would not be an iMessage.This is incorrect. The send button on an iPhone changes to blue when it is using iMessage. In this case it is green which would be the correct color for a sms text from a different brand of phone.

2972.name: The Deep End
2972.storyline: Margaret's date of birth is November 5, 1960. That's also Tilda Swinton's date of birth.

2973.name: Tropical Heat
2973.storyline: Anu Aggarwal was offered the film but declined.

2974.name: The 9th Life of Louis Drax
2974.storyline: Anthony Minghella was preparing a version of this film at the time of his death. The screenplay for this version was written by his son Max.

2975.name: The Monster Project
2975.storyline: This movie started as a Kickstarter project. It had a total of 124 backers according to the movie's own credits.

2976.name: Flirting with Danger
2976.storyline: This is a TV movie; even the sequence transitions will tell you that. So you can't expect another "Basic Instinct" here: the erotic parts are tame, and the direction has little cinematic style. The movie clearly counts on its plot and its actors to maintain your interest; the plot does, but it's nothing brilliant (there are, after all, only two suspects for the killings), apart maybe from the killing method, which is indeed quite unique. The actors are clearly the best thing about "Flirting With Danger", and provide some eye-candy (for both sexes). Charisma Carpenter, one of the most uniquely beautiful actresses out there, with a smile that's at once sweet and naughty, plays the main suspect / love interest for the hero James Thomas, and Victoria Sanchez gives an appealing and believable performance as his childhood friend who may have deeper feelings for him. Despite his dilemma (or should that be trilemma - Karen Cliché is also around, as the other suspect), Thomas is a lucky man - but will he live long enough to enjoy his luck? You probably know the answer to that one, but "Flirting With Danger" is still an OK way to pass 90 minutes. (**)

2977.name: Goldstone
2977.storyline: Selected as the greatest Australian film of 2016 by The Guardian.

2978.name: Vidocq
2978.storyline: First feature film shot with the new Sony digital 1080p 24 fps cameras to reach the screen (a year before Star Wars: Episode II - Attack of the Clones (2002)).

2980.name: The Phantom of the Opera
2980.storyline: The "London Opera House" used here is actually the Wimbledon Theatre.

2981.name: The Lodger
2981.storyline: Last role and only nude scene for Jillian Difusco, who played a dead victim at the medical examiner's.

2982.name: Kept Woman
2982.storyline: The bottle of wine Simon gives Jessica and Evan is branded "Chateau Poulette," after the film's director, Michel Poulette.

2983.name: Scooby-Doo Meets the Boo Brothers
2983.storyline: Shaggy's "truck" is actually a mid-1980s Suzuki Samurai.

2984.name: Master
2984.storyline: We put Regina Hall to the test to see how well she knows her own career. We quiz her about her early jobs, the thing that has her most concerned about hosting the Oscars, and more.

2985.name: Columbo: Caution: Murder Can Be Hazardous to Your Health
2985.storyline: In the closing credits of "Crime Alert", Alan J. Levi is listed as supervising producer, Todd London as co-producer, and April Raynell as writer. All three people performed those functions on this episode of Columbo (1971).

2986.name: The Legend of Sleepy Hollow
2986.storyline: Francois Gauthier performed as The Headless Horseman in a "Legend of Sleepy Hollow"-themed episode of Are You Afraid of the Dark? (1990).

2987.name: Lake Bodom
2987.storyline: Inspired by, but not based on, the Lake Bodom murders that happened on June 5th, 1960 in Espoo, Finland.

2988.name: Lavender
2988.storyline: The song sung in the film, referred to as "the fairy song", is a nursery rhyme called "Lavender's Blue".

2989.name: Mojave
2989.storyline: The third film to be released by A24 films to feature Oscar Issac. The first one was A Most Violent Year (2014) and Ex Machina (2015).

2991.name: The Cello
2991.storyline: On the poster, Academy Award, Tony, and Emmy-winning legend Jeremy Irons is placed on the bottom left over the credits which is something you never see in regular one-sheet poster artworks. Instead, the name of the writer Turki Al Sheikh and director Darren L. Bousman are placed on top but in fonts which are smaller than the cast on the bottom.

2992.name: Too Late
2992.storyline: Each of the long takes was shot on an entire 1000-foot reel of 35mm film.

2993.name: The Courier
2993.storyline: Jeffrey Dean Morgan is highly allergic to any metal that touches his skin.

2994.name: Luz
2994.storyline: I give Luz a 5 out of 10. I do this because I at least owe the makers of this movie their due. I think they did what they set out to do. The problem is that they didn't include the audience. A movie can be a lot of things; smart, angry, dijointed, simplistic, action packed, erotic, whatever.... But doesn't it still have to be appealing? Otherwise what's the point?Trust me. Whatever underlying tones or metaphors are present with this movie will not be reached by hardly anyone. And I would contest that those who claim to understand what's going on with this movie are fooling you and themselves.These art movies can continue to be produced the way they are. That's fine and even great, but give the audience a payoff, or something. Anything at all. This movie doesn't deliver anything for the effort you will put into watching it.

2995.name: The Wild Boys
2995.storyline: All boys are actually played by female actresses.

2997.name: The Wolf Hour
2997.storyline: Naomi Watts: [main character in her bare feet] June remains barefoot throughout the entire movie.

2999.name: Curious Caterer: Fatal Vows
2999.storyline: While the third film in the series, based on the fourth novel in the book series by Diane Mott Davidson. The previous two films were based on the second and seventh novels respectively.

3000.name: Gaami
3000.storyline: The diverse locations required for filming posed logistical challenges, ranging from humid South Indian villages to freezing Himalayan terrains. Extensive location scouting took place in regions such as Khtaling, Pyangong, Khardung La, Zanskar, and Leh during the winters of 2017 and 2018.

3001.name: Mermaid: The Lake of the Dead
3001.storyline: Both main protagonists' names are water-related. Roma Kitaev is nicknamed by his friends as "Kit", which means "whale" in Russian; His bride's name is Marina, from the Latin word "Marinus", which translates as "of the sea".

3002.name: Leave
3002.storyline: WeightlessWritten by Arve Isdal, Herbrand Larsen and Torkjell Rød. ( Lyrics)Performed by Audrey HornCourtesy of Cosmos Music

3003.name: Dark River
3003.storyline: The film is very loosely based on Rose Tremain's novel Trespass. Writer/director Clio Barnard wrote an initial screenplay that was much closer to the book, which focuses on two sets of of siblings in their sixties who become involved in a property dispute in France. After the initial draft, her producers encouraged her to make the story her own so that the final film, which focuses on only one set of siblings in their thirties and is set in England is only very loosely related to the book.

3004.name: The Cat and the Canary
3004.storyline: The house used in The Cat and the Canary (1978) was also used in The Omen (1976) (Gregory Peck) as the ambassador's home.

3005.name: 7 Khoon Maaf
3005.storyline: Based on Ruskin Bond's book Susanna's Seven Husbands.Ruskin Bond also acts in the film's climax as a Catholic Priest.

3006.name: The Grand Duel
3006.storyline: The music score is used in Kill Bill: Vol. 1 (2003).

3008.name: Labor of Love
3008.storyline: The original screenplay was written in 1992 and sold to 20th Century Fox in 1993. Harrison Ford was initially considered to play the lead with Sydney Pollack approached to direct. The production stalled when Eric Roth's subsequent screenplay for Forrest Gump (1994) recycled a similar plot device. The movie then languished in development hell for over twenty years.

3010.name: Naruto Shippuden the Movie: Blood Prison
3010.storyline: This anime film is located chronologically after the episode of Yami e no shissô (2011) and before the episode of Rokudaime Hokage Danzô (2011) from Naruto: Shippuden (2007).

3011.name: When a Stranger Calls Back
3011.storyline: The film was dedicated to actor Tony Beckley who played the villain in the original When a Stranger Calls (1979).

3012.name: Nadine
3012.storyline: The framed picture of Jeff Bridges in a uniform is taken from The Last Picture Show (1971).

3013.name: The Uncle
3013.storyline: Section Chief Kim: Sentenced to life for rape and murder... of your brother's wife. I did some research and found out you strangled her to death... after raping her. So the uncle who killed his brother's wife sexually harasses his niece, as well.

3014.name: Mafia
3014.storyline: The role of Rosa Nicolosi was considerably expanded from her novel counterpart to give more prominence to star Claudia Cardinale.

3015.name: The Exotic House of Wax
3015.storyline: Michelle Bauer was up for a role in this, but her new manager Robert Lombard talked her out of it saying it wasn't in her best interest and it conflicted with the scheduling of Colick (1997), a TV mini series she was appearing in. Also, according to Bauer, Lombard just didn't approve of what he called the low quality projects produced by Full Moon.

3016.name: Cryptozoo
3016.storyline: The film took 4 years to animate, between 2016-2020, in Richmond, Virginia.

3017.name: Homicidal
3017.storyline: William Castle: [gimmick] In the final reel, when Miriam is about to go into the house for the big climax, there was a one-minute "Fright Break" in which producer/director William Castle advised the audience that anyone too scared to see the climax could go into the lobby and get their money back. For this gimmick, Columbia shipped a cardboard "Coward's Corner" to theaters playing the film. Supposedly, audience members too frightened to see the climax could go to the "Coward's Corner" and wait there until the film ended and the rest of the audience filed past. Apparently no one took the offer.

3018.name: Prevenge
3018.storyline: Alice Lowe was eight months pregnant for the duration of the filming.

3019.name: Grand Tour: Disaster in Time
3019.storyline: Based on the novella "Vintage Season" by Henry Kuttner and C.L. Moore, which originally appeared in the September 1946 issue of Astounding Science Fiction. It was credited to Lawrence O'Donnell, a pseudonym used a few times by Kuttner and Moore.

3020.name: Hold That Ghost
3020.storyline: The Andrews Sisters were brought in after filming wrapped and the final nightclub footage was edited in after the film's completion.

3021.name: Romi
3021.storyline: Came here with low expectations. Was thinking it was going to be entertaining, but I was extremely wrong. The main character has a severe communication issue. The whole movie could have ended if she just mentioned the not so scary occurrences to ANYONE in the show, but she just makes excuses or focuses on the most random things. The artificial intelligence in the house plays only a role to annoy the viewer and create scenarios where the obvious jumpscares occur. Most of the show bounces around a predictable pattern. Main character does normal thing, gets a flashback, the home AI malfunctions, and/or obvious jumpscare. I ended up skipping after half the movie due to how annoying the home AI was. If you are looking for a futuristic horror movie, SKIP this one.

3022.name: Nightmare
3022.storyline: The BFI has the only 35mm print in the UK.

3023.name: Family Dinner
3023.storyline: The film was advertised as a domestic horror film and the mood and the location was very well met. In terms of action, the whole film takes place on a farm in the countryside (Lower Austria), the actors are all very convincing and were well chosen. Pia Hierzegger is of course fantastic as the aunt, very believable.The label horror film is too strong for me, although it certainly fits into the genre, but measured against today's usual horror films, the film is already rather harmless, more psychological thriller. Also, the film offers little surprising.The story: overweight teenager Simi visits aunt Claudia, a nutrition expert, in the countryside (with hopes to be helped with dieting), with (newly married) uncle Stefan and cousin Fillip (from the first marriage of the aunt). Simi feels uncomfortable from the beginning, the cousin a creep, the aunt strict, the uncle too nice?I felt they got inspired by films like "Get Out," "The Wicker Man," as well as some Hammer films from the sixties. Without giving more away, you definitely guess what the whole thing is leading up to in the course of the film. That's what I meant by unsurprising. I was missing a twist that would change your view of the story and question your perception, so to speak, but that twist doesn't come. Conclusion: well done, but not top notch.

3024.name: Track 29
3024.storyline: After screening the dailies of Gary Oldman screaming at the beginning of the film, projectionist Herbert Gambill suggested to the producer they use the John Lennon song "Mother" to accompany the scene, as both the scene and the song suggested primal scream therapy. The editors added it as temporary music and it wound up in the released film.

3025.name: Killers
3025.storyline: Nanette Bianchi's first of only two roles in her career.

3026.name: An Angel for Satan
3026.storyline: Barbara Steele's final Italian Gothic Horror film.

3027.name: Amp House Massacre
3027.storyline: Despite a visually tiring start, the movie gets interesting from this point on. The only entertainment for the social media phenomenon characters is drinking, sexuality, meaningless gestures and conversations. It doesn't start in a violent way, but it makes you wonder what will happen in the following minutes. The depressive Amanda character and her grandmother's behavior add humor to the film. The other phenomena seem very selfish, self-absorbed. It's ridiculous that they just sit and stare while their friends are drowning. I liked the atmosphere where they are trapped in the house and it suddenly becomes tense. The production speeds up and slows down but the pace is good. The deaths are not very effective, so they could have been a bit more disturbing. The act are in tune with each other and make an effort to be believable. Cassandra Scerbo suits this kind of production and I find her successful. There could have been a different ending. An enjoyable slasher.

3028.name: Momo
3028.storyline: John Huston's role was originally intended for Richard Widmark.

3029.name: The Gracefield Incident
3029.storyline: During filming, production was almost stopped due to the poor performances of the actors.

3030.name: Haunt
3030.storyline: The script did not call for any snow scenes but when it began snowing during production, a decision was made to keep filming.

3031.name: Anti Matter
3031.storyline: First feature-length film directed by Keir Burrows. All prior directorial credits were short films.

3032.name: Snowbound
3032.storyline: This movie isn't really a thriller or mystery, but more of a Chekhovian allegory about friends and colleagues who lose their way and become "snowblind" to the darkness enveloping them -- a metaphor for today's social and political environment where we are all puppets, both the actors and viewers, who are being manipulated by hidden puppeteers.

3034.name: The Scarlet Claw
3034.storyline: Listed in Journet's inn-register is Tom McKnight of New York. He was an adviser on Universal's Holmes series, and was married to Edith Meiser, a writer familiar to devotees of the radio productions "The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes" and "The New Adventures of Sherlock Holmes".

3035.name: The Bothersome Man
3035.storyline: The car used to pick up Andreas at the gas station is a Panhard 24, a French car not made since 1968.

3036.name: American Outlaws
3036.storyline: Treat Williams's final film before his death in 2023.

3037.name: The Humanoid
3037.storyline: First top-billed film role of actor Richard Kiel.

3038.name: The Invisible Man Returns
3038.storyline: This film's impressive visual effects, specifically the scene in which Vincent Price transitions from invisible to visible earned it an Academy Award nomination.

3039.name: Wild Indian
3039.storyline: The story is similar to On the Ice (2011), directed and written by Iñupiaq filmmaker Andrew Okpeaha MacLean.

3040.name: Fascination
3040.storyline: The film only played on 10 screens in the US. Worldwide release focused on Germany, where it played on 105 screens.

3041.name: The Barbarian Invasions
3041.storyline: On this IMDbrief, we present a Streaming Passport to just a few of our favorites from and about the world's neighbor in the North.

3043.name: Rider on the Rain
3043.storyline: The 1971 song by The Doors "Riders on the Storm" was reputedly influenced by this film. Jim Morrison allegedly was so taken in by the film and in particular its plot that he wrote the song as a result.

3044.name: What the #$*! Do We (K)now!?
3044.storyline: When this movie was released, both film critics and scientists noted that it was not entirely up front about the role that the Ramtha School of Enlightenment (RSE)--a New Age spiritual sect often characterized as a cult--played in its precepts, development, and production. Though J. Z. Knight appears early and often as an interviewed expert in the movie, it is not until the end that she is identified as the founder of RSE, and her most controversial aspects (among which are her claim to be able to "channel" a 35,000-year-old warrior spirit named Ramtha) are not included at all. Many sources (for example, John Gorenfeld's September 2004 Salon article and Alison Willmore's October 2020 New York magazine article) state that this movie's three directors, William Arntz, Betsy Chasse, and Mark Vicente, were at the time also followers of Knight and RSE. Mark Vicente later became involved with another prominent cult: NXIVM, the human-potential-development and sex-trafficking pyramid scheme founded by convicted con artist Keith Raniere. After leaving NXIVM, Vicente participated in the exposé documentary series The Vow, revealing many of the cult's damaging tactics; however, nowhere in The Vow does Vicente admit that NXIVM was not his first time adhering to a cult-like group.

3045.name: Dhol
3045.storyline: Priyadarshan's one film without Paresh Rawal.

3047.name: The House at the End of Time
3047.storyline: Winner of the Audience Award at Gävle Horror Film Festival 2016 (Sweden).

3048.name: Dial M for Middlesbrough
3048.storyline: Annette Crosbie and Selina Griffiths are mother and daughter in real life.

3049.name: Wacko
3049.storyline: Theatrical film debut of Andrew "Dice" Clay, who was billed simply as just "Andrew Clay."

3050.name: Kindred
3050.storyline:
At the end of the film The Doctor and Thomas lock Charlotte inside the room and takes the baby away.
Normally, hospital room doors cannot be locked.

3051.name: Vigil
3051.storyline: First ever film from New Zealand to be selected to screen in competition at the Cannes Film Festival.

3052.name: Tastes of Horror
3052.storyline: Jae-hwal segment in English is entitled 'Rehabilitation'.

3053.name: Algiers
3053.storyline: Animator Chuck Jones based the Warner Brothers cartoon character "Pepe Le Pew" on Pepe le Moko (Charles Boyer).

3054.name: Terror Train
3054.storyline: Filmed simultaneously with its sequel, Terror Train 2, in April of 2022, and which released two months after it.

3055.name: Evidence
3055.storyline: Dale Dickey (Katrina Fleishman) and Stephen Moyer (Detective Dale Reese) were co-stars in the HBO series True Blood (2008-2014).

3056.name: The Bridge Curse
3056.storyline: Based on the legend of the haunted bridge at Tunghai University.

3057.name: Darker Than Night
3057.storyline: A remake, Darker Than Night (2014), was made in 2014.

3058.name: The Stone Tape
3058.storyline: The bar helper recalls an African American soldier she met during WWII telling her that there were guppies in the wall of Taskerlands or maybe "duppies". In Carribean Folklore, a "Duppy" is a ghost or spirit, typically malevolent.

3059.name: Star Wars: Rogue Squadron
3059.storyline: In September 2022, it was announced that development for this film was halted, and that Lucasfilm had taken it off its release schedule. This was because Patty Jenkins had quit the project due to the lengthy development process, and she didn't want to delay filming "Wonder Woman 3" any further. In December 2022, it was reported that "Wonder Woman 3" was not moving forward and considered "dead". This led to Lucasfilm renewing the deal with Jenkins. However, on March 7, 2023, it was announced that the project had been shelved.

3060.name: The Big Fix
3060.storyline: Richard Dreyfuss broke his wrist just before shooting began. Rather than delay shooting, they worked his cast into the script.

3061.name: Await Further Instructions
3061.storyline: The surname of the family, Milgram, refers go the Milgram test of obediance to authority, a theme dominant throughout the film. It is also revealed that the family resides on Stanford street, a reference to the Stanford Prison experiment which studied similar themes of perceived power and authority.

3062.name: The Harbinger
3062.storyline: Veteran Films is a non-profit production company created to provide jobs for Veterans, Victims of Domestic Violence, and Native Americans. Veteran Films takes film novices and places the above individuals into jobs they can succeed at while learning the film business, and allows the individuals to migrate into other jobs they may find more suitable to their future within the business. Veteran Films' focus is hiring local crew and talent, or those connected in some manner locally.

3063.name: Radioland Murders
3063.storyline: George Lucas has stated that the two main characters, Roger and Penny Henderson, are actually the parents of Richard Dreyfuss' character Curt Henderson from American Graffiti (1973); making this film a bit of a semi-prequel.

3064.name: Spasmo
3064.storyline: George A. Romero shot several minutes of CinemaScope footage inserted into the United States release of the film, depicting the killings.

3065.name: Room for Rent
3065.storyline: At about the 50 minute mark, Joyce visits her neighbor. While she is helping her neighbor take off her shoes on the couch you see the beige pillow switch (or flip over) to a maroon pillow.

3066.name: Last Embrace
3066.storyline: Miklós Rózsa score for this film was composed in the style of Bernard Herrmann who worked regularly with thriller director Alfred Hitchcock. This film's composer Rózsa had worked with Hitchcock himself once, on Spellbound (1945).

3067.name: Dhuruvangal Pathinaaru
3067.storyline: Karthick Naren was forced to fund this film himself as the producers he narrated the script to were reluctant considering his age as he was just 21. The film went on to become a huge critical and commercial success.

3068.name: Purity Falls
3068.storyline: Also known as 'The Madam of Purity Falls' while shown on the Lifetime Channel.

3069.name: Dangerous Pleasures
3069.storyline: Jacy Andrews plays as Valerie Spito, an attractive, lusty blonde black widow, who has survived the loss of six rich husbands.  She attracts the interest of a police detective and an insurance investigator, Grady Kent (played by Burke Morgan).  These guys don't know what they're in for.  The investigators follow their suspicions into intriguing encounters with their manipulative suspect, and these interactions form the bulk of the story.Jacy Andrews is credible as the dangerous widow, but Morgan's Kent seems a bit naive.  Kent's nympho assistant, Monica Mayhem's Jules, is sexy and compliant, with little opportunity to display much acting talent.  The male characters are either naive or blinded by lust (or perhaps a little of both), so they are a bit short of credible.Eroticism:  B, Good.  Multiple sexual encounters, with oral sex and backdoor play (why?). Women: B-, Good.  Sexy, but not the best. Men: C.  Adequate, but not too studly (if a guy can make such a judgment) Story: B, not bad for soft-porn. Acting: C.  Jacy Andrews is fair, but the rest either were unconvincing or had little opportunity to really perform beyond the sex scenes. Overall: C.  Fair vehicle for soft-porn.

3070.name: Ajnabee
3070.storyline: Akshay won Filmfare Award for Best Villain for his role, his first Filmfare award.

3071.name: Lies and Deception
3071.storyline: Dreadful film, with some of the worst acting this side of "Dynasty." I've seen Mädchen Amick before, and liked her, but this time she definitely sank to the level of the script. But give her credit--at least she had the good sense to look embarrassed and uncomfortable (constipated even) virtually every time she uttered one of her poorly-written lines. And who is Andrew W. Walker? My best guess is, he's related to the director or casting director, because how else could such an unappealing and untalented actor be cast in this part? The chemistry between the "leads" wasn't just missing--it had actually turned putrid and emitted a foul odor. Save yourself a lot of aggravation and 2 hours of your precious time. Avoid this movie!!!

3073.name: 5 Card Stud
3073.storyline: Robert Mitchum said he turned down the role of Pike Bishop in The Wild Bunch (1969) in order to make this film.

3074.name: Dead Man's Folly
3074.storyline: Amy Folliat (Constance Cummings) quotes sixteenth century poet Edmund Spenser's work "The Faerie Queene": "Sleep after toil, port after stormy seas,/ Ease after war, death after life, doth greatly please." This verse is inscribed on Dame Agatha Christie's tombstone.

3076.name: The Unknown Country
3076.storyline: SlomoWritten by Nicholas Chaplin, Simon Scott, Rachel Goswell (as Rachel Ann Goswell), Neil Halstead,Christian Savill (as Christian Brook Savill)Performed by SlowdiveCourtesy of Dead OceansBy arrangement with Secretly Music Group

3078.name: Accident
3078.storyline: In 2024 this movie is adapted by Korean movie maker with movie title The Plot (Korean: Seolgyeja). It's a 2024 South Korean crime thriller film directed by Lee Yo-sup, starring Gang Dong-won. An adaptation of the Hong Kong film, Accident (2009), it tells the story of Yeong-il, a designer who orchestrates a commissioned murder as a perfect accidental death, and gets caught up in an unexpected incident. The film was released on May 29, 2024.

3079.name: Article 15
3079.storyline: Ayushmann Khurrana revisits his 10-year-long journey in the Indian film industry and breaks down his most iconic characters in movies like Vicky Donor, Andhadhun, and Chandigarh Kare Aashiqui.

3080.name: Magellan
3080.storyline: The Comander's name is a conflation of the names Anthony Nelson and and Roger Healy, two characters in the TV series "I Dream of Jeanne"

3081.name: The Body
3081.storyline: This movie had been in development for fifteen years, with Universal Pictures intending to distribute and Liam Neeson set to star. In the end, the project was dropped after Universal became nervous about the religious themes.

3083.name: The Haunting of Julia
3083.storyline: The Heimlich maneuver, or abdominal thrusts, a method of clearing an airway obstruction, was not widely known or taught at the time of this film. Dr. Heimlich first published papers on the technique in medical journals in 1974 and 1975. It wasn't until 1976 that the American Red Cross and the American Heart Association began to include it in their first aid classes and literature.

3084.name: Most Wanted
3084.storyline: Based on Victor Malarek's story of Alain Olivier's wrongful imprisonment in Bangkok.

3085.name: The Priest
3085.storyline: Jessie Cherian: What is happening here Father? I don't understand anything.Fr. Carmen Benedict: There are many things in this world that humans cannot understand, Jessie.

3086.name: Possession
3086.storyline: This film was completed in 2007 and was set for a Febuary 2008 wide release in theaters. But due to Yari Film Group (the film's distributor) filing a Chapter 11 protection (Bankruptcy Code), its release was pushed back close to a dozen times, and was then finally given a straight-to-DVD March 2010 release in the United States.

3087.name: Macumba Sexual
3087.storyline: Alice Brooks: I had that horrible nightmare again...Novio de Alice: Again?Alice Brooks: It was in the desert. She was there. It's always the same woman. A strange woman. Her name is Tara. She's dark skinned and very beautiful. She carries two beasts with her. A man and a woman. She lets them loose and they throw themselves upon me. She laughs. And suddenly she's dead... with a strange animal upon her.

3089.name: Malibu Shark Attack
3089.storyline: The final shot is a close-up of rescue helicopter approaching the west coast disaster site shows the logo (inverted) of Scott & White Hospital and Clinic which is located in Temple, Texas 1400 miles east.

3090.name: Isle of the Dead
3090.storyline: Rose Hobart was cast in the film, but Boris Karloff became ill and the production had to be shut down until he recovered. By the time he returned, she was already working on another film and was replaced. However, Hobart said in a 1984 interview that she can still recognize herself in long shots.

3091.name: The King and Four Queens
3091.storyline: Clark Gable formed a production company with his The Tall Men (1955) co-star Jane Russell and her husband Robert Waterfield in order to produce this film. However, the stress of producing took such a toll on the 55-year-old Gable's already guarded health that he never produced another movie.

3092.name: Spoor
3092.storyline: Spoor (2017) (Pokot) is a 2017 Polish crime film directed by Agnieszka Holland, adapted from the novel "Drive Your Plow Over the Bones of the Dead" by Olga Tokarczuk. It was selected to compete for the Golden Bear in the main competition section of the 67th Berlin International Film Festival. At Berlin, the film won the Alfred Bauer Prize (Silver Bear). It was selected as the Polish entry for the Best Foreign Language Film at the 90th Academy Awards®, but it was not nominated.

3093.name: The Winter Lake
3093.storyline: It's a fairly decent movie, a little draggy, but why don't they buy some lights if they want to be in the business? The good parts, you just watch a practically black screen and can't figure out what's happening.

3094.name: Sauna
3094.storyline: The word 'Poika' means 'Boy' in Finnish. However, the character 'Poika' is played by a girl 'Sonja Petäjäjärvi'.

3095.name: Nine Dead
3095.storyline: The film was shot in sequence.

3096.name: Backstabbing for Beginners
3096.storyline: Josh Hutcherson was set to play the lead role in this movie, but when co-Writer and Director Per Fly informed him they would be shooting in Morocco and Jordan, Hutcherson dropped out because of safety reasons.

3097.name: Gourmet Detective
3097.storyline: Dylan Neal accidentally set his hair on fire during filming.

3098.name: The Possessed
3098.storyline: Referenced in Once Upon a Time... in Hollywood (2019)

3099.name: The French Connection 3
3099.storyline: An unsold TV pilot based on the character from The French Connection (1971).

3100.name: Nocturne
3100.storyline: When Police Lt. Joe Warne says, "I like that alibi. It's round, it's firm, it's fully packed.", he is riffing on a phrase often used in advertising for Lucky Strike cigarettes at the time: "So round, so firm, so fully packed."

3101.name: Shuttle
3101.storyline: During filming, Peyton List was on the phone with her boyfriend when the crew drove away, leaving her in a very sketchy neighborhood in Boston, not realizing she wasn't on the bus. After a few minutes, they realized she wasn't and went back for her.

3102.name: Nelly Knows Mysteries: A Fatal Engagement
3102.storyline: The two leads star as husband and wife in the TV series: When Calls the Heart.

3103.name: The Bygone
3103.storyline: [first lines] Kip Summer: [narrating] I remember an old Indian story my mom used to tell be before I went to sleep. About a shadow, that blanketed the land in darkness. I know it had a happy ending of some sort, but, all I can remember is the way it made me feel. Seemed like it could just swallow you up, the way she told it, like it was right around the corner. Never knew what it was she was talking about - at least I didn't user to.Kip Summer: I always wondered if guys like Cassidy, Crocket, and Crazy Horse came rising up from the holes we dug for 'em, if they'd even recognize this place. Plain they called home, the west... it isn't dead yet. It's just on fire, and no one seems to care.

3104.name: After
3104.storyline: It was a particularly cold day when it came time to film the carnival scene and was physically exhausting for the actors. Even though it was filmed in the south near Birmingham, Alabama, it was freezing. It was shot through the night into the next morning. Temperature was 32 degrees with 10 mph wind gusts.

3105.name: Spiral
3105.storyline: Chandra West and Lochlyn Munro also appear as a couple in another horror movie, The Tooth Fairy (2006).

3106.name: The Falling Star
3106.storyline: Here is a movie with outstanding direction, plot, writing, cinematography, and acting including movement and dance. Use of rhyming color and motion in the visual factors such as autos, costumes, rain, and other set factors was beautiful. This was my first Gordon and Abel movie. I won't go through the plot, as this has been shared in another review. A hilarious outing, reminiscent of Chaplin, Tati, Keaton, Lloyd. The plot included missed connections, swapped identity, thwarted revenge, and a real twist on the "femme fatale" trope. I laughed out loud several times. Not a typical Hollywood movie. I'd say this film has a Belgian surrealist humor. Recommended.

3107.name: The Six Wives of Henry Lefay
3107.storyline: When Henry and Veronica give Barbara 2% of the business there is a cutout of Henry dressed as Henry VIII whose marriages closely resemble those of Henry Lefey.

3108.name: Stolen
3108.storyline: Screenwriter Glenn Taranto wrote his first draft of the screenplay, originally titled "The Boy in the Box", in six days over a two week period. He was inspired by the famous unsolved case of "America's Unknown Child" aka The Boy In The Box. Working backwards Glenn created an original scenario detailing how such an unsolved crime might have occurred. Should anyone have any information regarding the real "Boy In The Box" case they are encouraged to contact the Philadelphia, PA Police Department.

3109.name: Witch Hunt
3109.storyline: While making the circuit of talk shows to promote this movie, Dennis Hopper stated it was the strangest movie he had been in.

3110.name: Criminal Passion
3110.storyline: Joan Severance, and Tony Denison both guest starred in the TV show "WiseGuy"(1987). Tony Denison became the lead undercover agent in a few episodes after Ken Wahl injured his foot when a 850 pound dolly ran it over twice.

3111.name: An Interview with God
3111.storyline: 100% of profits received by Giving Films will be donated to organizations supporting foster care, mental health services, and veterans.

3112.name: The Boy Behind the Door
3112.storyline: The two directors are lifelong friends and look somewhat like grownup versions of the child actors in their film.

3113.name: Kill Me Three Times
3113.storyline: Teresa Palmer (Lucy Webb) was pregnant during filming, which is noticeable in the above the waist shots, and bulky clothing she wears.

3114.name: Cut
3114.storyline: The name of the mysterious white masked killer was "Scarman".

3115.name: Babysitter's Black Book
3115.storyline: Give You What You LikeWritten by Avril Lavigne, Chad Kroeger and David HodgesPerformed by Avril Lavigne

3116.name: The Nanny
3116.storyline: The last Hammer film to be made in black and white.

3117.name: Ugly
3117.storyline: The police station scene was meant for just one minute duration, but the actors in the scene stretched it to 14.5 minutes while improvising.

3118.name: Black Angel
3118.storyline: Like her character Mavis, Constance Dowling would die at a relatively young age. She passed away at age 49 due to cardiac arrest. The same fate would befall her son Peter Tors, who died in 1998 at age 41.

3119.name: Prey
3119.storyline: Blumhouse Productions has been a major force in the horror genre since 2007's Paranormal Activity became a worldwide sensation. See how IMDb users rank all of Blumhouse's horror movies since 2007.

3120.name: The Woman in Green
3120.storyline: This marks the third Sherlock Holmes' movie starring Basil Rathbone where Holmes faces Prof. James Moriarty, after The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes (1939) and Sherlock Holmes and the Secret Weapon (1942). Curiously, Moriarty is portrayed by a different actor in each movie: George Zucco, Lionel Atwill, and Henry Daniell, respectively.

3121.name: Who Can Kill a Child?
3121.storyline: Narciso Ibáñez Serrador wanted Tom and Evelyn to speak English to each other throughout the movie. This would add to Evelyn's communication troubles since she isn't able to speak any Spanish at all. However, since the producers feared that the public would get distracted by the subtitles, they made a last minute decision and had both characters dubbed into Spanish for the original version.  Ibáñez Serrador has always been very critical of this decision, he felt that it damaged the atmosphere of the film.

3123.name: V.I. Warshawski
3123.storyline: Kathleen Turner went on to play V.I. Warshawski on BBC radio.

3124.name: The Face of Love
3124.storyline: Inspired by a real life incident when director Arie Posin's mother was convinced she saw her late husband walking down the street.

3125.name: Johnny Eager
3125.storyline: Robert Taylor fell in love with Lana Turner on the set of the film and asked his wife Barbara Stanwyck for a divorce, although Turner was not in love with him and tried to discourage him from doing so.

3126.name: Homunculus
3126.storyline: The "Homunculus" movie is based on a manga with the same name.

3127.name: The Disappearance of Haruhi Suzumiya
3127.storyline: With a runtime of 162 minutes, it is the longest theatrical animated feature ever produced, but the third longest animated feature overall. After the extended version of Uchû senkan Yamato: Kanketsuhen (1983) with 163 minutes and the extended version of In This Corner (and Other Corners) of the World (2016) with 168 minutes.

3128.name: Another Thin Man
3128.storyline: Two tragedies befell William Powell prior to the making of this movie: the unexpected death of his fiancée, Jean Harlow, and a difficult battle with colon cancer that required colon bypass surgery and new radiation treatments. Production of this film was delayed as a result. Powell was given a standing ovation when he finally returned to the set for filming.

3129.name: Thirteen Women
3129.storyline: There were only 11 actresses in the movie, not 13. Scenes involving the remaining two, Phyllis Fraser and Betty Furness, ended up on the cutting room floor. Several other roles also were telescoped in the editing process when the film was shortened from its original 73 minutes to 59 minutes for theatrical release.

3130.name: Irresistible
3130.storyline: Susan Sarandon worked on the script with writer/director Ann Turner for six months before principal photography began in Australia (from early March 2005 through late April 2005).

3131.name: Spellcaster
3131.storyline: Executive producer Charles Band allowed the filming to take place in a 12th century castle in Italy he had bought for filmmaking, Castello di Giove.

3132.name: Fear in the Night
3132.storyline: The Manor House used for the exterior shots of the school appears as a hotel used for a clandestine assignation in The Rough & The Smooth (1959); as the tennis club in School For Scoundrels (1960); as Rod Taylor's training ground in The Liquidator (1965); as "The Elizabethan Hotel" in The Avengers episode Wish You Were Here [12/2/69]; as "Merston Manor" in Randall & Hopkirk (Deceased) episode The House On Haunted Hill [16/11/69] as residences in episodes 7 & 14 of the same series; and as the restaurant used by Strand and his companion in Special Branch S4 episode 12, Diversion.

3133.name: Betrayed by Love
3133.storyline: During her phone call with Alison from her car, about 20 mins into the movie, Carrie drives by the same house twice (the blue shed behind the main structure)

3134.name: And Never Let Her Go
3134.storyline: True story based on the book by Ann Rule.

3135.name: 4 Kids Walk Into a Bank
3135.storyline: Project notes, plot, and industry news

3136.name: The Body Stealers
3136.storyline: Actress Hilary Heath who plays Julie is not mentioned in the cast list at the end of the film.

3137.name: Too Beautiful to Die
3137.storyline: In the "Porno Game" Conti plays on the computer, with each key tap good for one pelvic thrust, as he taps frenetically, the line marked "Piacere" (pleasure) grows, while the one for "Potenza" (potency) shrinks.

3138.name: The Cokeville Miracle
3138.storyline: T.C. Christensen required actor Nathan Stevens, who played David Young, not to interact with the children on set until filming. That way their reactions to Young were genuine and real.

3139.name: Natalie
3139.storyline: The first Asian film made in 3D format.

3140.name: Death Walks at Midnight
3140.storyline: The wooden sculptures Stefano creates throughout the movie were made by the Italian-based Japanese sculptor, Tomonori Toyofuku (credited as Toyo Fuku)

3141.name: Ocean Deep
3141.storyline: A different approach for this kind of thing. Not a bad watch, but it might be useful to know beforehand that it's pretty slow moving at the outset. If you're looking for a fast-paced shoot 'em up, this ain't it. However, the slower parts are carried by beautiful coastline scenery as well as by the general atmosphere of the movie, which provide a calming backdrop for a rather laid back mystery about a marine botanist (Lochlann O'Mearian) researching undersea flora that may have medicinal benefits. He goes missing while on a dive, and his wife (Connie Nielsen) struggles with his absence, wondering, as we do, if there was foul play.The story, and their relationship, is revealed in pieces, sometimes using flashbacks. Her scientist husband's work was controversial, and there are indications of corporate espionage. Adding to the intrigue, she begins to get insights, perhaps of a psychic nature(?) as to what may have happened.You may have your own suspicions; one hunch I had early on turned out to be correct, but there are some genuine surprises toward the end, when it gets considerably more intense, although it never becomes what you would call a thriller. It's really more of a psychological drama, with just a hint of the supernatural or mystical.

3142.name: Good Neighbours
3142.storyline: Emily Hampshire appeared in each of the first four movies directed by Jacob Tierney: the short film, Dad (2002); Twist (2003); The Trotsky (2009), and Good Neighbours (2010).

3143.name: Quintet
3143.storyline: To add realism, Robert Altman had all the sets kept at freezing temperatures. The slight impairment to the lips in extreme cold is noticeable when the actors speak.

3144.name: Killers from Space
3144.storyline: At approx 38:08 an alien is taking measurements and you hear him saying something. It was "The readings are...25,26 to the right...27,28,29 to the left...30,31 up...32,33 down." played in reverse.

3145.name: Departing Seniors
3145.storyline: Javier: Ginny, we can discuss the magnitude of your cuntiness later. Right now we have to go.

3148.name: Across the Furious Sea
3148.storyline: Chinese director Cao Baoping's relentless crime thriller is simply more proof that there's ample life in Mainland China's genre cinema.A propulsive, intense flick that barrels forward with numerous inquiries and high-speed pursuits, never letting up for at least two thirds of its duration. Anchored by Huang Bo's committed turn as a desperate father searching for his missing daughter, the film is quite successful in creating a chaotic atmosphere that swallows it whole, for better or worse (but mostly the former). In that light, it often reminded me of The World of Kanako.So, the positives first; the performances are uniformly good, the pacing just about as relentless as it gets, the chase scenes as expertly filmed as anything in modern Chinese thrillers. And the story is quite an emotional rollercoaster too; despite the film's structural deficiencies, it still manages to hit the required story beats. The most impressive sequence here marries both cathartic emotions and visceral action, coinciding a freeway chase with an incoming storm, complete with a huge tornado and fish that rain from the sky.However, parts of this film fail to completely satisfy, for example its barely coherent storytelling that is partly masked by enthusiastic filmmaking, but reveals its weaknesses upon later reflection. Some events happen almost randomly, characters disappear without further explanation and/or circumstances regarding their fates remain unclear. I've encountered these problems in other Chinese thrillers too, so it's not like I was too surprised by their appearance. Transitions between some scenes are abrupt and editing sometimes feels off; altogether more proof this film needed some more time in post-production.That being said, Across the Furious Sea is one of China's more successful genre efforts in the last few years; both commercially and creatively. Cao Baoping isn't new to crime thrillers, so this will serve just fine to further boost his profile. Genre enthusiasts would do well to check this one out, provided they keep their expectations realistic.

3150.name: Secuestro
3150.storyline: In the beginning of the film, Patricia enters a bank vault with safe deposit boxes. The vault has two thick steel doors and probably also thick steel reinforced concrete walls. Patricia then receives a phone call on her mobile phone. Within such vault, there is no cell phone reception.

3151.name: Kung Fu Yoga
3151.storyline: This is the sequel to The Myth (2005), Jackie Chan played the archeologist Jack in both movies. This can be related by the painting of the queen that Jack gets from the Dasar expedition in The Myth (2005).

3152.name: Unforgettable
3152.storyline: A box office flop in the United States, this took two years to secure a theatrical release in the UK.

3154.name: Bad Match
3154.storyline: Harris' injured hand is magically unbandaged and unharmed between two scenes where it's bandaged.

3155.name: Sleepless
