4505.storyline: This film was the feature-length adaption of a short film with the same title made in 2011 by the same co-directors and writer. The success of the short film led to the increased funding for the adaption and to the casting of top-billed actors (Alex Pettyfer and others).

4506.name: Patricia
4506.storyline: An uplifting tale of a wealthy heiress who just wants to be loved, "Patrizia" achieves nothing less than the culmination of European cinema's unfulfilled promise. Anne Parillaud's youthful exuberance is perfect for the title role, elevating the film to a plateau beyond the reach of mundane 1-10 rating scales. Likewise the fortunate viewer will doubtless be elevated by the sheer joie de vivre indelibly etched into every fiber of this stunning motion picture. Alas, some may be dismayed by the gratuitous nudity, lesbian incest, or even the insinuation of jungle-girl/gorilla-suit-wearing-boy romance. This, however, can be readily rectified by prompt removal of any superfluous objects(heads, thumbs, etc.) from crucial bodily passageways. Regardless, someday this richly rewarding, seldom-seen masterpiece of minimalist excess will take its place alongside the great works of the cinematic art.

4507.name: The Scent of Rain & Lightning
4507.storyline:
I will not rate or review this movie. It may be brilliant.
Just to say that I noticed it because it was classified on the Net as Western.
It is not a Western.Westerns can be a lot of things, but this ain't it.

4508.name: Kill Game
4508.storyline: Laura Ashley Samuels and Joe Adler have both guest starred on Modern Family (2009).

4509.name: #DoYouThinkIAmSexy?
4509.storyline: PrinsesaPerformed by Pop GirlsLyrics by Paolo Emmanuel Madrid (as Paolo Madrid)Music by Paolo Emmanuel Madrid (as Paolo Madrid), Himig Borja, Bojam (as Julius James De Belen)Published by Viva Music Publishing, Inc.Produced by FlipMusic Productions Co.Mixed, mastered and arranged by Bojam (as BoJam) and Himig Borja of FlipMusicRecorded by Joel Mendoza at Amerasian StudiosCourtesy of Viva Records Corporation

4510.name: Boomerang
4510.storyline: Huh... The films in Yugoslavia are just getting worse and worse. Again we have very primitive, beer down your throat buddy film here. And actually very boring one. Just when you think, start watching very beginning that something can happen, in very next moment you are splashed with same hysterical approach Serbian directors have to nationalism,patriotism and social coolness with which Serbs are so proud of.The idea is in some way cute and chilling but director Dragan Marinkovic have done twisted work with it where the plot actually don't exist. It's just a simple,plain story in which they wanted to present that all miseries and misfortunes that happen returns as boomerang. Good becomes bad, bad becomes good, criminal becomes honest, idiot becomes clever, witty person. It is just too much considering that characters aren't actually real. And the situations they put themselves are overbuilt and pretentious. The pace and mise-en-scene are dreadful. Actors were losing themselves practically laughing at themselves for doing mediocre work. The only good thing in the whole film is character and performance Milena Dravic did. She is absolutely breathtaking, I was at the edge of my seat on the scene at the movies. She was absolutely wonderful, an Oscar winning performance for supporting actress.But all in all this film is completely not worth seeing cause a lot of people would be  annoyed and by the direction and by the pace. Pity cause the idea is really good but completely not put into right direction. 2/10 + 2 for Milena Dravic only

4511.name: Hamraaz
4511.storyline: In the 1990's this movie Hamraaz, with some changes, was remade as Deewana ( rishi kapoor, divya bharti & sharukh khan ) and Imthian ( sunny deol, saif ali khan & raveena tandon.)

4512.name: Ferat Vampire
4512.storyline: The Ferat rally car used in the film was in fact a prototype for an unreleased sports model Skoda 110 Super Sport produced by Skoda Auto, now generally referred to as the Skoda Super Sport 'Ferat Vampir RSR' in homage to the film. White version of it, without 'vampiric' elements, made a brief appearance in earlier film Tomorrow I'll Wake Up and Scald Myself with Tea (1977).

4513.name: The Wasteland
4513.storyline: According to producers Joaquin Padró, Mar Targarona, and Marina Padró, the Casademunt film was shot on a moor in the province of Teruel, whose location is "a vital ingredient to delve into history."

4514.name: Catalina Caper
4514.storyline: When filming began on this movie in late-summer 1965, Tommy Kirk was on probation with Walt Disney Studios after an arrest for marijuana possession on Christmas Eve 1964. Although later cleared by the District Attorney's office, he was immediately replaced after the arrest by Michael Anderson Jr. for the role of the youngest son in the John Wayne movie The Sons of Katie Elder (1965), for which principal shooting was to begin January 4, 1965. Newspapers of March 20, 1965, reported that Kirk had signed a five-year contract with American-International Pictures and on June 3, although details were not given, newspapers reports about Kirk stated that "His recent bout with the police in a mid-west city didn't do his clean cut kid image any good and his career with the Disney films seems over."

4515.name: Honey Britches
4515.storyline: Producer Fred Olen Ray bought this 1971 film (which had already been re-titled "Shantytown Honeymoon" by Something Weird Video), shot a 5-minute introduction scene for it with John Carradine as the Judge of Hell, re-titled it "Demented Death Farm Massacre...The Movie" and sold it to Troma Films in 1986. Ray's company made six times their investment back on the deal.

4516.name: AfterDeath
4516.storyline: On the cabin's porch is a sign which reads "Tabula Rasa", literally Latin for "erased slate". It refers to the theory that individuals are born without built-in mental content and that therefore all knowledge comes from experience or perception.

4517.name: Wolf Hiding
4517.storyline: Nick Cheung's first standalone Chinese film.

4518.name: Rage
4518.storyline: Aiko Maki: I called the police

4519.name: The Caller
4519.storyline: The silent movie playing on the TV is Nosferatu: A Symphony of Horror (1922).

4520.name: You Shall Not Sleep
4520.storyline: Argentinean films are known because of some characteristcis that most people think "this is just OK." I used to think that as well, yet this thriller film amazed me. Insomnia is such a powerful word that might describe You Shall Not Sleep, which refers a not only to a sleep disorder but also of being awake by their your own decision.Imagine you're an actor/actress whose dream is about to come true; however, there is one condition: spent more than 100h without sleeping in a abandoned psychiatric hospital to personify a specific insane character. How would you feel? How would be your perfomance?Overall, this film worths to have a chance. I know Argentinean films have no much admiration, but I swear this film is a special one wich makes you think if it is possible to be into a rol as much as in a real mental health hospital.

4522.name: Keep Your Distance
4522.storyline: The red letters showing here and there, throughout the credits, spell T-H-A-N-K Y-O-U F-O-R W-A-T-C-H-I-N-G.

4523.name: The Fine Art of Love: Mine Ha-Ha
4523.storyline: Lady Helena: [Being shown the girls] What beautiful biological specimens!

4524.name: Detective Conan: The Last Wizard of the Century
4524.storyline: This marks the first appearance of Ai Haibara, as Vi Graythorn in the English Dub. Oddly, she was never introduced in the English dub due to Funimation canceling the dub only a few episodes short of her debut. Weirdly, she appeared in the movie, but for English only viewers, people questioned who she was because she was never introduced before.

4525.name: Terminal Voyage
4525.storyline: The entry code for the confidential computer files is 3263827, the same number as the garbage masher in Star Wars: Episode IV - A New Hope (1977).

4526.name: Anohana: The Flower We Saw That Day

4527.name: Retribution
4527.storyline: This film was originally supposed to get a bigger domestic theatrical release in America, but the studio executive who supported the film was fired and replaced by another person who decided to give this film a more limited theatrical release instead. As a direct result of this, plans for a potential sequel were eventually abandoned altogether despite the fact that this movie did well in various foreign territories.

4529.name: Ghosts of the Ozarks
4529.storyline: Premiered at the Austin Film Festival in October 2021. Sequel will be made.

4531.name: Sunday
4531.storyline: Celebrities parodied by Irrfan Khan in his turn as a theatre actor - Shah Rukh Khan from Don (2006), Amitabh Bachchan from Deewaar (1975) and Himesh Reshammiya as a singer-composer turned actor.

4532.name: Aurora Teagarden Mysteries: Reunited and It Feels So Deadly
4532.storyline: Marilu Henner's character, Aida Teagarden says, "Besides, you know I remember everything". This is a nod to Henner's real life condition, hyperthymesia, or total recall memory.

4533.name: Bad Girl Island
4533.storyline: In 2018 this movie was rereleased under the name Mysterious.

4534.name: Rushed
4534.storyline: The film's poster has the sigma symbol (generally used in mathematics to denote a sum) instead of the letter 'E'. This symbol is found in the middle of the fraternity's name.

4535.name: Letters from a Killer
4535.storyline: During filming on May 9, 1997, Patrick Swayze broke both legs and tore four tendons in his shoulder when his horse threw him into a tree. He said he grabbed the horse's mane and flipped himself around so that he wouldn't hit the tree with his head.

4537.name: Bhoot
4537.storyline: The film broke several rules of Bollywood formula films and was nonetheless successful. There were no songs, it was only two hours long, it was heroine-centered, and it was a horror story, not a love story.

4538.name: Conquest
4538.storyline: This film lost more money for MGM than any other of its films during the period from 1920 to 1949.

4539.name: Chase in the dark
4539.storyline: Suspense thriller. Very rare to see such a good movie in Kannada film industry. Credit to the director for coming up with such a subject.Good BGM,Good Cinematography,Good songs.

4542.name: My Mother's Wound
4542.storyline: Serbian Miroslav says "the best tattooist 'in the Middle East and Balkans',it is a Turkish expression.

4545.name: The Red Shoes
4545.storyline: Italian censorship visa # 99509 delivered on 15 December 2005.

4546.name: Havenhurst
4546.storyline: The landlord's last name "Mudgett" is the actual last name of serial killer H. H. Holmes.

4547.name: Keane
4547.storyline: Shot in 32 days for less than $1 million.

4548.name: Bliss
4548.storyline: The film was originally rated X by the Movie and TV Ratings Classification Board. The producers appealed to the ratings board, and received an R-18 rating on the second review with no edits made.

4549.name: Totem
4549.storyline: Blumhouse Productions has been a major force in the horror genre since 2007's Paranormal Activity became a worldwide sensation. See how IMDb users rank all of Blumhouse's horror movies since 2007.

4550.name: The Third Key
4550.storyline: The last film made at Ealing Studios, London.

4551.name: The Mystery of a Hansom Cab
4551.storyline: This movie is set in the 1880s, yet the first street scene shows a solid yellow lane marker in the middle of the street. These lane markers were first introduced to Australia in Sydney in the 1920s.

4552.name: Granny
4552.storyline: This is Cratty Klanz's first video game adapted film and their second feature film overall.

4553.name: Extremity
4553.storyline: The costume designer Cherie Howard has been a fashion designer for 25yrs prior to working on Extremity.

4554.name: The Legend of Kaspar Hauser
4554.storyline: Sheriff: The King is coming. I know it now...

4556.name: A Mother's Rage
4556.storyline:
The detective tells the Sheriff near the end that she did a good job and saved lives. In fact she violated some fundamental law enforcement procedures and caused the loss of life:
1) Do not enter a facility where there is an armed suspect by yourself. A deputy was with her but she sent him away.
2) Always secure a suspect by handcuffing them. Instead of doing this with the male, she freed the female, who then attacked the male, who then shot the female, which required the Sheriff to shoot the male. Had she followed proper procedure, none of these injuries would have taken place.

4557.name: Original Bliss
4557.storyline: It was just one of my thoughts I had when I watched this. This is in many respects nothing like the movie Taxi Driver - it does however have a key moment of the movie fully blown into a theme ... kind of like, how not to talk or behave around women. Martina Gedeck can play weird characters and she is amazing in this. So no pun intended as always.But telling a woman your "hobby" (for lack of a better word or expression), even more so if the main male character ("love interest") is supposed to be into psychology ... well maybe it does make sense. But not the way you may think it does.While nothing is shown explicitly - well apart from nudity that is of course, you should not be too sensitive when it comes to the theme of sexuality ... also some violence ... it is not an easy movie to watch ... it tries to break barriers and it is not a how to guide ... it is two broken individuals .... both looking for love ... unable to form or express that in the confinements of how society sees it and approves of it ... you have to dig weirdness to say the least and go into quite the dark places ... mentally and otherwise ... this is not healthy (or happy in any sense of what we would attribute to it)! But well depicted!

4558.name: The Shadow in the North
4558.storyline: The striped dress that Billie Piper (Sally Lockhart) wore is the same costume previously worn in North & South (2004) by Daniela Denby-Ashe (Margaret Hale) and in Bleak House (2005) by Gillian Anderson (Lady Dedlock).

4560.name: The Retreat
4560.storyline: Popular culture frequently depicts the Wendigo as a demon/spirit with antlers occasionally portrayed as a human cursed or possessed as a result from cannibalism, it represents an evil embodiment of greed, gluttony and unchecked exploitation of natural resources, serving as a cautionary tale to avoid such behavior. Traditionally the Windego (minus the antlers/horns) was described as a very gaunt, near emaciated human/human form with insatiable hunger, in some stories it grows in proportion to what it consumes to many times the size of humans and thus is always ravenous. Other commin attributes are an overwhelming stench of death, an aura of chilling cold, an ice heart, and tattered or shredded lips/flesh

4561.name: Black Magic
4561.storyline: Orson Welles often said that making this film was the most sheer fun he had ever had working in the cinema.

4562.name: Curse of the Fly
4562.storyline: This film was rarely seen for many years after its original release in 1965. As a result of this, it was the only one of the original "Fly" films that never received a VHS or LaserDisc release. It did not even receive a home video premiere at all until 2007, when it was released on DVD for the first time ever, in "The Fly Collection", a 4-disc box set that contained both it and the previous two films in the trilogy, The Fly (1958) and Return of the Fly (1959), as well as a special features DVD.

4563.name: Naked Girl Murdered in the Park
4563.storyline: Robert Hoffmann character drives an Azzuro Blue Medium, 1971 Fiat 850 Spider. Bertone designed with a 4cyl, 58hp rear engine.

4564.name: Apprentice to Murder
4564.storyline: Released on star maker vhs in Canada who did several direct to video movies in Canada

4565.name: Site Unseen: An Emma Fielding Mystery

4566.name: The Great Flamarion
4566.storyline: The Great Flamarion (1945) marked the debut of William Wilder as a motion picture producer. Wilder, who was sometimes credited as W. Lee Wilder on his later films, was an "eastern industrialist," according to a September 1944 Hollywood Reporter news item, and was the brother of director Billy Wilder.Billy Wilder rarely talked about his brother, and when he did the theme was always the same: "A dull son of a bitch," Billy said of him in 1975. Years later he called him "a fool" who thought he could make it in Hollywood simply because his more famous brother had.

4567.name: Slaughter of the Innocents
4567.storyline: Director James Glickenhaus made his son audition for the part of the second lead just like any other actor. He purposely left his son's name off the audition tape when he showed the footage to Scott Glenn. Out of all the tapes, Glenn said he liked Glickenhaus' son's audition the best. When he was told that it was the director's son, Glenn refused to believe it.

4568.name: The Perfect Husband: The Laci Peterson Story
4568.storyline: Dean Cain said in interviews that since Peterson had not yet gone to trial when the movie was being filmed, he tried to play him as if he were innocent.

4569.storyline: 88 is a political thriller with a pointed message for *right now*. I went to the theatre for a few hours of mindful entertainment and was thrilled to find a thought-provoking, riveting and well-told story.Lovers of political thrillers will be deeply satisfied. Movie buffs will notice the nods to Hitchcock, Scorsese and All the President's Men. 70s babies like me will reminisce about School House Rock during a brief and brilliant segment/explainer on SuperPacs and Citizens United. Must see.

4570.name: Bud Abbott Lou Costello Meet the Killer Boris Karloff
4570.storyline: The film was originally banned in Denmark due to the scene where corpses play cards.

4571.name: You'll Find Out
4571.storyline: Filmed August 8-October 11 1940, the 7th of 8 features to star Boris Karloff and Bela Lugosi, and the only time that fellow Hungarians Lugosi and Peter Lorre ever shared the screen.

4572.name: Urban Myths
4572.storyline: It is the prequel to the series Goedam (2020).

4573.name: The Stay
4573.storyline: During the opening credits montage, the song "Closer" by Rob Mayes is playing, Rob Mayes plays Chris in this movie.

4574.name: Circle of Friends
4574.storyline: Outside it is dark but inside you can see daylight through the windows in the scene with the chimney flue.

4576.name: Tebusan Dosa
4576.storyline: Di Akhir PerangPerformed by Nadin AmizahWritten by Nadin AmizahArranged by Lafa PratomoCourtesy of Massive Music Entertainment & Aquarius Pustaka Musik

4577.name: #Blue_Whale
4577.storyline: This is not even a movie, it was a huge waste of time. Really a nonsense movie with a dry and arid plot, soundtracks at random on random moments, technically terrible (especially in the final scene where the cops open the killer's PC where the screen is out of the picture), silly actors with a few very small exceptions. There are really few words to describe this film nightmare, I find it shameful and especially disrespectful towards the real victims, I appreciated the concept of sending an important message to society, but this is the wrong way. I would have really preferred to watch a news report rather than lose almost two hours of my life to see this scempio that wants to send a very important message but the latter is overwhelmed by a thousand and more mistakes.

4579.name: Get Away If You Can
4579.storyline: Ed Harris and Riley Smith previously appeared in Radio (2003).

4580.name: Ruby Herring Mysteries: Her Last Breath
4580.storyline: The outside of the diner that Ruby and her dad are at, during about 12 minutes in, is the same diner in Twilight.

4581.name: In Love and Deep Water
4581.storyline: Thought that this movie was a cute and whimsical love story with a bit of a murder mystery mixed in on a luxury 5-star cruise ship that has rich cliental. The ML and FL meet on the ship - he is the top butler and she is not a client but a girl who runs on the ship at the last moment to catch her cheating boyfriend - who happens to be not on the ship, but off on a hot springs trip at a different location with the butler's girlfriend. The FL gets stuck on the ship as it pulls away from the port. The characters in the film, namely the murder suspects, are all theatrical in nature and their costuming. Easy to watch and the murder is solved with an easy going cute ending to a love story as the ML and FL try to solve the murder together since they witnessed it but no one, including the Captain of the ship believes them.

4582.name: Intruder
4582.storyline: Yoo-jin: You still doubt I'm your real sister. Do you feel guilty because of that? Because you can't have me?

4583.name: Rift
4583.storyline: Filmed on location in only 15 days.

4584.name: Seven Deaths in the Cats Eyes
4584.storyline: Although a gorilla is shown looking through a window early in the film, and he remains in the shadows until he is shown dead, the main character refers to him as an orangutan.

4586.name: Shock to the System
4586.storyline: Second of four films in the "Donald Strachey Mystery" series.

4587.name: The Man on the Eiffel Tower
4587.storyline: Producer Irving Allen was the original director, but after only three days of shooting, Charles Laughton threatened to quit if Burgess Meredith did not take over. Laughton directed the scenes in which Meredith appeared.

4588.name: Dr. Gift
4588.storyline: Michael Della Pia, Kellen DeRuy, Justin W. Fox, Jennifer Michelle Stone, Brandon Krum, Lisa Hinds, John Meacham, Jeramis McFadden, Denny Nolan, Billy Culbertson and Michelle Hill also appeared in Passages of Nexus (2023)

4591.name: Chariot
4591.storyline: The entire film was shot in a space less than 50 feet by 12 feet.

4592.name: Holiday in Spain
4592.storyline: This movie was shown in "Smell-O-Vision". The theater was equipped with a system that gave off various odors in sync with this movie. The opening scene involved a butterfly flitting through a rose garden, with accompanying delicious odors. Later on, a barrel of wine fell off of a cart going up a hill, and rolled down the street only to smash at the bottom, again to the accompanying odor. The perfume of The Woman of Mystery (Dame Elizabeth Taylor), i.e. Scent of Mystery, was a key element to the story, and involved in the climax of the mystery.

4593.name: Kyaa Kool Hai Hum
4593.storyline: When the film turned out to be a hit, a C grade film titled " Kya Garam Hain Hum" was launched. Starring Harinam Singh, Anil Nagrath, Vinod Tripathi.

4594.name: The Ice Cream Truck
4594.storyline: The director, Megan Freels Johnston, announced at a Q&A after the premiere that there might be sequel about a delivery truck driver.

4595.name: La casa del sortilegio
4595.storyline: Third part of the series "Le case maledette" (Doomed Houses) also including The Sweet House of Horrors (1989), The House of Clocks (1989) and House of Lost Souls (1989).

4596.name: Coda
4596.storyline: This film was originally intended for theatrical release but was released straight to video and television instead.

4597.name: Shadows in an Empty Room
4597.storyline: Clips of the car chase from this film are used in the Geico commercials "Do dogs chase cats?"

4598.name: Mirror Game
4598.storyline: It is very interesting to see that Aynabaji was shot at Keraniganj Central Jail when this jail was not inaugurated so far. Besides, this movie was shot in Kashimpur Jail and shooting in real jail is a such a rare experience for BangladeshI movie.

4599.name: Border Run
4599.storyline: At the end of movie, Sharon Stone and Billy Zane cross the border going into Arizona, towards Tucson, the American flag has only 48 stars .

4600.name: Extramarital
4600.storyline: Bob: [rhetorically, as Elizabeth drives away her car] My God, child,! What have you gotten yourself into ?

4601.name: Charlie Chan in London
4601.storyline: This was the first of the Charlie Chan films with an original screenplay not based on one of the Earl Derr Biggers stories.

4608.name: Sorority Sister Killer
4608.storyline: The killing of Tara, as filmed, would have been impossible. If you look closely, Tara is standing in front of a brick wall with an iron fence on top of it that comes up to just about her armpits. To push her off, the killer would have had to lift her at least two to three feet to heave her over the fence. But the actual killing scene, filmed from the side, shows a straight shove and Tara falling over something that was at the highest about the top of her thigh.

4609.name: The Sintern
4609.storyline: I don't really like movies that is church/religious related but I do like murder mysteries. I have to praise the lead - Evelyn Giovine, she's a pretty good actress and I think she'll have a promising career even if it's for this type of movies. The real shining star though and main reason I checked this movie is out is - Samuel Larsen. He is such an underrated actor yet I believe he is extremely talented. I've seen almost everything he's been in and I think he should be in more movies, have better parts etc. And OMG, that voice of his when he sings is simply amazing. I hope he does more movies in the future and that he becomes a huge success with his music. So yes, this movie turned out good and I really wasn't expecting that.

4644.name: A Song from the Dark
4644.storyline: At the time I'm writing this, the film currently has four 10 Star written reviews and an overall rating of 2.4 Stars. While, IMO, the 10 Star reviews are being overly generous, I do not think that the film is being fairly judged by the 2.4 Star overall rating.The film has an interesting concept and the main themes deal with spirits, possession, cursed marks, sigils and shamanism that are derived from Nigerian beliefs. You're given a limited, basic understanding of these beliefs and they are just enough to sorta guide you through the film.The actors weren't overly impressive but they weren't bad either. After the first five minutes or so, the film has a rough, slow start to it but picks up towards the end and becomes a bit more interesting and engaging. Some of the special effects were decent and others were mediocre CGI.I'm not gonna say it was awful because it held my interest but I cannot deny that I wanted it to give more than it did. It is lacking something special but I can't pinpoint what it needs.I would say that if you're a fan of films about spirits and possession, you might find something different and interesting by watching this. However, if you are looking for something that guarantees you will have chills and thrills you might be a bit disappointed. If you plan on watching it, watch it for the concept not the horror aspect.

4708.storyline: One of the worst movies I've ever seen, so terrible it's almost funny at some points. The random jump cuts to musical montages, the still shots for no apparent reason, and the best - when one character says "we should go shopping!", while they're shopping?The storyline makes next to no sense, the acting is pretty atrocious, and the pacing is astonishingly bad. It's kind of like 'Get Out', expect terrible, and seemingly written by a teenager who watched Get Out and then thought "I could do something like that".Great movie to watch if you need to kill some time, otherwise, don't bother.

4711.name: Vampir
4711.storyline:
Vampir is inspired by the real vampire cases that occurred in Serbia in the early 1700s. Those were the origin of vampires. Though the film is set in modern times it's based on those myths, superstitions and folk elements. Tomovic wanted to show a more mysterious side of Serbia.
The film also serves as an allegory of an immigrant child who was raised abroad and comes back to his ancestry's country, where he is confronted with the local habits, traditions and way of life which are hard to accept at first.

4712.name: Beyond Loch Ness

4713.name: It's Beginning to Look a Lot Like Murder
4713.storyline: Who but Lifetime? Some of their original TV movies are gladly sincere, others split the difference between earnest storytelling and deliberate kitsch (whether of the romantic or thriller varieties), and still others are so unabashedly over the top that they become gleeful B-movie delights. As if the name alone weren't indication enough, I'm very happy to report that 'It's beginning to look a lot like murder' falls quite decisively into the third category. It's not as completely wild and fun as the likes of 'Pom poms and payback,' or 'Secret lives of college escorts'; in fact, it rather takes the approach of being farcical precisely because it pretends so hard at being straitlaced and straightforward. Yet anyone who has spent any time watching like-minded fare in other genres (chiefly horror and sci-fi) will readily recognize the tack that is adopted in these eighty-five minutes, and provided you can get on board with such fare, this is a minor delight!The narrative is pointedly, irreverently direct, with all elements perfectly aligning Just So and accentuating the artificiality. Of course protagonist Diana (and best friend Riley, with whom she regularly speaks) would be an avid listener of true crime podcasts, and of course she would be established right away as an enthusiast of murder mystery novels. Why wouldn't she be? Of course Diana and Riley are suspicious of everyone and everything, and believe they have great insight on a real-life mystery; of course every possible moment is filled with falsely tense, suspenseful music cues, sudden and unexpected sound effects, and/or patently contrived, inflated dramatic beats (e.g., suddenly turning around and coming face to face with - gasp! - oh, no one of importance). The direction of Amy Barrett (well, isn't that an unfortunate name to have these days), the scene writing, dialogue, and characterizations in Dana Lin's screenplay, and the acting of all involved are bent toward purposefully hokey, plastic phoniness. Of course Cristine Prosperi would seem to stand out most as she depicts our protagonist, but Angelie Simone seems hellbent on upstaging Prosperi in that regard in her extra-exaggerated depiction of Riley - but that's certainly not to count out other co-stars including Erin Gray, Travis Burns, and more. 'It's beginning to look a lot like murder' is conscious bunkum, and in every way it very much wants us to know it.That's not to say that it isn't well made. There are some unexpectedly nice shots scattered throughout, and Thomas L. Callaway's cinematography is smart and admirable. The hair and makeup work is lovely, and the costume design, and art director Maxwell Mahan really just let his imagination run wild. Though the cast bends their skills to distinctly dishonest ends, their performances are solid and beyond reproach just as they are. Why, this little flick joyfully smashes together both the murder mystery and the holiday romance, and even for as plainly bogus as the amalgamation is - not least as some scenes switch moods on a dime - none of this is accidental, or ill-considered. To that same point, though the holiday hues are primarily just seasonal seasoning, they are not exclusively so, and there are some genuine, somewhat clever ideas in the root plot. At the same time the film is firmly aware of what flagrant balderdash it is in total, and there are absolutely plenty of moments so outrageous as to inspire laughter. And I guess that leads us to the chief definitive fault of 'It's beginning to look a lot like murder,' which is tonal inconsistency. The feature is undeniable baloney, and it never pretends otherwise. Even so it swings a little too much, with too much disparity, between riotous absurdity, warm romance, and darker mystery or thrillers vibes, with the latter two facets being played with notably more seriousness. If Barrett or Lin had chosen just one track instead of hopping between both somber and overwrought, and embraced that one track more fully, then the end result would surely have been more enjoyable overall.All told I actually do like this, and it's capably entertaining all on its own very forthright accord. It's just that with a little more judicious care applied one way or the other, I'm very sure it could have been either a terrific romp like 'My killer client' or 'Wheels of beauty,' or a more thoughtful, sober drama or thriller like 2006's 'Fatal trust,' with Amy Jo Johnson, or 2021's 'Lethal love letter' with Clare Grant. In any event, I think those who are receptive to all that the medium has to offer, and Lifetime - good, bad, weird, real, flippant - will have a good time watching this; if not, well, there's not anything here to change your mind. Don't go out of your way for this title, but if you do have the chance to watch and are ready to engage with it on its level, then 'It's beginning to look a lot like murder' is worth checking out.

4715.name: Schizopolis
4715.storyline: Steven Soderbergh cast his ex-wife, Betsy Brantley, to play his character's wife. Their two characters were a husband and wife who had drifted apart and could not communicate.

4716.name: Detective K: Secret of the Living Dead
4716.storyline: Follows Detective K: Secret of Virtuous Widow (2011)

4719.name: Residue
4719.storyline: Both Natalia Tena and Iwan Rheon have starred in Game of Thrones. Tena as Osha and Rheon as Ramsay Bolton.

4720.name: Mad Fate
4720.storyline: I mean Mad Fate is already a great pun - so my summary line indeed falls into the category of no pun intended (if you even classify it as such). If you've seen Limbo ... well I don't think the previous movie of the director will be able to prepare you for what is going to happen here. Mayhem would be one way to describe it - the main actor is really good. The character he plays .. I sort of would find it great to have him as a friend in real life.On the other hand ... maybe not! One thing is for sure, anyones life would be ... way more interesting with him in it. What a great powerhouse performance. The movie can be described as mad ... the structure .. same thing! I never was able to guess where it would lead me! Whom are we following, who is the main subject? And many other questions you may have .. really well made, well written and acted by everyone involved! Such great characters and visuals ... but also quite violent! So not for the sensitive people amongst us.

4722.name: It's Only Money
4722.storyline: Mae Questel, who plays heiress Cecilia Albright, was a prolific character actress, most famous as the voice of cartoon characters Olive Oyl, and Betty Boop.

4723.name: Peeper
4723.storyline: The opening titles are not printed or written out on screen, but are instead spoken to the audience by Humphrey Bogart impersonator and impressionist Guy Marks. This performance has often been erroneously attributed to Jerry Lacy, who had played Bogart in Herbert Ross' and Woody Allen's Play It Again, Sam (1972).

4724.name: The Mysterious Castle in the Carpathians
4724.storyline: Ludek Sobota, Oldrich Kaiser and Milan Lasica were considered for the part of count Teleke, eventually played by Michal Docolomanský.

4725.name: Mandie and the Secret Tunnel
4725.storyline: Snowball the cat actually belongs to Owen Smith (writer/director).

4726.name: Left for Dead
4726.storyline: Steve Byers (Carrie TV Remake) and Danielle Harris of the Halloween films portray "Tommy" and "Nancy". Those could easily be referencing Halloween possibly for Associate Producer Tommy Lee Wallace and Nancy Loomis who played Annie Brackett in the original Halloween and Danielle recreated the iconic role in Rob Zombie's Halloween remake. Or popular character "Tommy Doyle" or even Nancy Stephens (Nurse Marion). And the novel/movie Carrie features the character "Tommy Ross" and the original Carrie starred Nancy Allen.as mean girl Chris.

4727.name: The Bride and the Beast
4727.storyline: The original working title was Queen of the Gorillas.

4728.name: The Love of a Brute (Hitodenashi no koi)

4729.name: Thin Ice
4729.storyline: Alan Arkin and Greg Kinnear had appeared together previously in 'Little Miss Sunshine ' (2006).

4730.name: Bullshot Crummond
4730.storyline: The lead cast of this movie (and its source "Bullshot Crummond" play) was played by a comedy troupe known as the Low Moans, an Anglo-American fringe theatre group. The gang included Ronald E. House, Diz White, and Alan Shearman.

4731.name: House of Cards
4731.storyline: Oddly, the film leaves out the detail which explains the title - the all-important list of names which George Peppard gets hold of is, in the novel, in code, which is broken via a knowledge of Tarot cards. In the film, it's just a list of names, so the brief moment where the Patience Collier character is seen laying out Tarot cards has no resonance for the later scenes.

4732.name: Ajin: Demi-Human
4732.storyline: Mamoru Miyano, who voiced protagonist Kei Nagai in Ajin (2016), voices Nagai's IBM spirit in this film.

4733.name: The Wisteria Manor
4733.storyline: I LOVED IT! It has a ghost, a villain, and young love. When you're watching this feature film you feel like you're actually in the story. You get emotionally attached to the characters. The spectacular narration makes you believe you have a stake in the outcome and what happens seems to really matter. This film consists of a mix of many still photos, striking footage, along with artwork to create scenes like colorful paintings. The originally-composed music was perfect too. Not too dramatic or loud, but enhanced just the right amount of feelings at the right times. So overall these components come together for a captivating experience!Have you ever read a book then saw a movie made from the book later? If you have, I am willing to bet that you liked the book better than the movie. Not with this film! With THE WISTERIA MANOR you don't miss a thing!

4734.name: Gears of War
4734.storyline: Dave Bautista has expressed great interest in playing the main character Marcus Fenix and has been pursuing the role for years.

4735.name: Surongo
4735.storyline: Surongo is Afran Nisho's first movie on the big screen.

4736.name: The Ghosts of Borley Rectory

4738.name: Female Human Animal
4738.storyline: Leonora Carrington: You have to own your self. To hand it over to some half-assed male, I wouldn't recommend.

4739.name: Sherlock Holmes: Incident at Victoria Falls
4739.storyline: In the dialogue, it is revealed that both Holmes and Watson are in in their mid-fifties. In reality, Christopher Lee and Patrick Macnee, both born in 1922, were about 70 years of age at the time of this production.

4740.name: Cryo
4740.storyline: [first lines] The Inventor: Do you know the first Bible story I heard as a boy? Lazarus, raised from the dead. After that, I always wished I could bring back my mother. Of course, that never happened. But I'll always remember those first embers of hope. Maybe someone could.

4741.name: The Anchor
4741.storyline: Or is it old news? No pun(s) intended of course. And a movie that may keep you guessing - or you may be able to see through it quicker than others. That being said, it really is well told and amazingly acted. For a horror/thriller movie that is. But also generally speaking - hopefully you will be able to enjoy this for what it is. And go on the journey getting the most of it.South Korean cinema is really something to look out for. Not just for thrillers - but those too. I thought that anchor would mean this would have something to do with ships - but I was quite wrong. It also shows that I really do not read what the movies I am about to watch are about.Shock moments work and the guessing game was something I did almost until the end. I reckon the conclusion made a lot of sense.

4742.name: Accused at 17
4742.storyline: The caves that the girls drive past on the way to Willis Canyon are the back entrances to Bronson Cave, better know as the Batcave in 1960's TV series Batman (1989).

4743.name: The Boys Club
4743.storyline: The female liquor store manager is Bif Naked, an actress and singer. Her song 'The Letter' is featured in the film.

4744.name: Hailey Dean Mysteries: Killer Sentence
4744.storyline: The plot involves the early release of a man jailed for the murder of his wife. His claim of the murder being an accidental shooting because he mistook her for an intruder is reminiscent of the real life case of South African Paralympic track star Oscar Pistorious. Pistorious was sentenced to jail for killing his girlfriend because he claimed he believed her to be an intruder. He has since been released on parole.

4745.name: Cry Wolf
4745.storyline: The final of three film collaborations between director Peter Godfrey and Barbara Stanwyck; the others are Christmas in Connecticut (1945) and The Two Mrs. Carrolls (1947). The pair developed a strong, lasting friendship while working on these films.

4746.name: El crack
4746.storyline: The director pays a personal homage to some of the Madrid's most emblematic movie theaters (most of them already disappeared). So throughout the movie appearances of Cine Imperial, Cine Imperial, Cine Ideal, Cine Avenida, Palacio de la Música, Cine Callao, Cine Capitol, Cine Rex and Cine Imperial can be seen.

4747.name: The Hunting
4747.storyline: Filmed in Mantua, OH, a suburb of Cleveland, where Peyton Hillis played for the Browns in the 2010-2011 season.

4748.name: Self Isolated
4748.storyline: Director Chad Ridgely cast Rachel Alig as the lead in Murder Van after working with her on this film.

4749.name: Persona
4749.storyline: There are very few ratings on this and no reviews, which I find a bit odd.It is certainly a unique movie, but then again, many Japanese movies of this genre are. The synopsis doesn't really capture the idea. Danda is not a very large part of the movie, as you'll notice by the fact that he isn't in the top cast.The movie revolves largely around the mask maker, the groups who oppose each other, who Hiroku truly is, and the phenomenon itself. The wearing of masks extends into other schools and eventually becomes somewhat of a fad. Many people choose to be "reborn" into a new person by shedding their personality and using the mask to reveal their new one. This leads to unhinged behavior, including violence in some cases.It definitely has the message of who a person becomes when they become anonymous. Much like how anonymity on the internet tends to allow for more freedom of speaking one's mind. There is a lot going on, but I don't feel like it is hard to take it all in. Certainly some elements could've used more screen time, but dragging the movie out probably would've been difficult. For an hour and a half watch, it is pretty good and keeps you fairly interested in figuring out what exactly is going on in terms of who is who, and what not. In some ways, it is predictable, but in other ways it can be a bit elusive and has a different ending than expected.As for the cast, you'll certainly notice some fairly popular people on the Top Cast section. They've also worked together in other movies, so seem to do well on screen together.

4750.name: The Snorkel
4750.storyline: The screenplay is based on a novel by Anthony Dawson, the British character actor probably best known for playing Professor Dent in 'Dr. No'.

4751.name: One Point O
4751.storyline: During Simon's programming, code quickly flashes. The scrolling code is a Perl script that virus scans HTTP/FTP downloads request on a UNIX server after passing through the Squid proxy server. This is a real project named "Viralator".

4752.name: Ju-on: The Curse 2
4752.storyline: The opening 30 minutes of the film is simply a recap of the first film Ju-on (2000).

4753.name: Lost: Final Chapter
4753.storyline: Originally titled "Lost: Beginning of the End" but this title was already used as the title of a special Lost retrospective show that aired on local ABC affiliates in January 2010.

4754.name: Kucch To Hai
4754.storyline: Ding Dong Ding Dole song was a rage that time.

4755.name: Fleshtone
4755.storyline: Last film to be directed by Harry Hurwitz.

4756.name: Lift
4756.storyline: Griping horror with twist and turns. Kavin holds the flim with perfect grip.

4757.name: Detective Byomkesh Bakshy!
4757.storyline: In a deviation from Bollywood traditions, the OST has been composed entirely by independent music artists. Early in 2014, Banerjee and his production team set out to find artists whose music would fit into the story of the film. After shortlisting about 200 songs from non-Bollywood artists across the country, the team began whittling the list down to a handful of songs and artists.

4758.name: Te3n
4758.storyline: Amitabh Bachchan suggested the director to shoot the film in Kolkata.

4759.name: The Benson Murder Case
4759.storyline: The screen rights for the original 1926 source novel, the first in the Philo Vance series, was purchased by Paramount from author S.S. Van Dine for $17,500.

4761.name: Ouija
4761.storyline: When the concept of the movie was first presented to him, director 'Toppel Lee' was hesitant to accept since there was already an earlier movie made based on the game (Spirit of the Glass (2004) by Jose Javier Reyes) which he described as well-made. So instead of focusing on the game, they decided to focus on the characters being haunted by a ghost.

4762.name: Frenzy
4762.storyline: The blockade scenes inspired by The Battle of Algiers movie.

4763.name: Solvent
4763.storyline: In 2008, the director approached his grandfather, Otto Zucker, seeking permission to incorporate his images into future art projects and films. Zucker's response was clear: "Wennst mi in a Film gibst, dann wü i a richtiger Bösewicht sein." ("If you put me in a movie, make me a real villain.") This idea stayed with the director for years, even after Zucker's passing. The director expressed hope that it would have made his grandfather proud.

4764.name: Last Suspect
4764.storyline:
Last Suspect (2023)A talented female lawyer's daughter get kidnapped and insist to defend a murderer who is killed his girl friend brutally...
She accepted kidnappers demand and succeeded...
But final twist would be unpredictable....
Must watch court drama thriller...!In the city of Ao Cheng, located in Southeast Asia, a female Chinese lawyer Chen Zhiqi has exceptional competence in legal practice, having maintained a record of never losing a case. Her daughter is kidnapped out of the blue. And the kidnapper demands that she defend a murder suspect and that only when she wins the case within seven days can she save her daughter. Chen has no choice but to agree. With the help of police officer Jin Zhixiong, she begins to have a clue. As the investigation unfolds, Chen Zhiqi discovers that the case is very strange in many terms. Both of the victim's body and the crime scene have been tampered with. The suspect Danwen, fair and clear, thin and obedient, doesn't seem to be the real killer. Chen Zhiqi and Jin Zhixiong's actions draw attention of the culprit behind the murder, and their investigation meet with numerous obstacles. As the evidence appears to the surface piece by piece, Chen Zhiqi successfully defeats the antagonistic forces, wins the case, and finds her daughter. Just as Danwen regains his freedom, the kidnapper who abducts Chen Zhiqi's daughter appears, and the truth is finally unraveled.

4765.name: The Black Camel
4765.storyline: Of the five Warner Oland Charlie Chan films based on the original Earl Derr Biggers novels, only this one still survives. The other four are believed to have been lost in one of two fires, one in the 1930s and the other in the 1960s.

4766.name: Murder Syndrome
4766.storyline: The opening epigram "For Centuries, theologians, philosophers and poets have looked into the universe in search of proof of the devil. It would have sufficed to look into the depth of their souls." is likely apocryphal, as an an attribution to a Hieronymus A. Steinback in the XVII Century is not verified by any other source.

4767.name: Gehenna: Where Death Lives
4767.storyline: This was funded as a Kickstarter project. Those who contributed have their names added at the end of the credits.

4768.name: Below the Fold
4768.storyline: Partly inspired by the real life disappearance of Branson Perry. Perry disappeared from his home in Skidmore, Missouri on April 11, 2001. The case is unsolved.

4769.name: When Black Birds Fly
4769.storyline: According to the director, as with his previous film "Where the Dead go to die", the budget for this movie consisted solely of electric bills and computer parts. He considers the time and suffering that went into making it the biggest expense.

4770.name: The Caveman's Valentine
4770.storyline: The film is dedicated to Billie Neal, with whom Director Kasi Lemmons worked on Eve's Bayou (1997) and Gridlock'd (1997).

4771.name: Degree of Guilt
4771.storyline: The story is riveting, although the screenplay just bit too drawn out in places. I think the 3 hour run time could be shaved by a skillful editor by deleting a couple of scenes here and there without losing any of the drama or suspense. After a couple of hours in, the viewer knows where the climax is headed to and I felt myself saying to the tv, let's get on with it. Every single actor did superb work in their roles...it was far superior than most made for tv productions. The only other flaw would be something for trial attorneys. The defense attorney does a great job shooting holes in the key eyewitness testimony, but does not even cross-examine the final 'clothing' witness for offering what is only circumstantial evidence. Then, in summation, the defense does not even mention the prosecution's wholly circumstantial case (clearly reasonable doubts were on the table) but rather gives only a brief appeal to character. The final, final scene, although delivering great shock appeal, would likely be unnecessary to the outcome if the defense attorney was scripted to be more adept at courtroom defense.

4773.name: Tarzan and His Ape Wife: Christian Tale
4773.storyline: Craig: [coming into the scene with a creepy, wide-eyed expression] Hey!

4774.name: The Clouded Yellow
4774.storyline: A Newcastle trolley bus with an orange top, which was the corporation's colour, was repainted yellow to tie in with the film title despite the film being in black and white.

4775.name: The Eyes
4775.storyline: The director said the movie was influenced by the films 12 Angry Men and Saw, as well as the suspense films of Alfred Hitchcock and Agatha Christie.

4777.name: Cold Heaven
4777.storyline: One of seven films that actress Theresa Russell has made with director Nicolas Roeg. The films include Eureka (1983), Track 29 (1988), Cold Heaven (1991), Hotel Paradise (1995), Bad Timing: A Sensual Obsession (1980), Insignificance (1985) and the "Un ballo in maschera" segment of Aria (1987).

4778.name: Dark Web: Descent Into Hell
4778.storyline: The film doesn't suck, but it's not "good" either. I say this because there is/was so much potential to make this a pretty good B flick but it was all lost by poor direction.Too many extensive unnecessary scenes, not enough time spent on putting the story together cohesively. If more time was spent in "the drawing room" and putting a better storyboard together this one would be a keeper.I appreciated the use of today's tech to make the film visually enjoyable - it's not lacking in production quality just lacked direction.

4779.name: Murder, He Says
4779.storyline: The $70,000 that Bonnie stole in the movie would be worth $988,000 in 2019.

4780.name: Dangerous Ishq
4780.storyline: The film was a total disaster.

4781.name: Bloodknot
4781.storyline: When the character purchases beer in the variety store he tosses a case of Formosa beer over his shoulder. This beer is made by the Brick Brewing Company of Waterloo Ontario Canada. Obviously filmed in the province of Ontario, it's worth noting that beer cannot be purchased in variety stores in that province to this day.

4782.name: Doctor Faustus
4782.storyline: Elizabeth Taylor has no lines of dialogue.

4783.name: Thr3e
4783.storyline: Ted Dekker, author of the novel, was on set nearly every shooting day. In many cases he put three lines into the shot as an homage to the book cover. While some of these lines are drawn on walls and such, they also show up as objects (chalk, pencils, etc...).

4784.name: The Wicked City
4784.storyline: The USA DVD from Image Entertainment includes an English dub audio track.

4786.name: Charlie Chan in Egypt
4786.storyline: A young Rita Hayworth appears in a minor role, before she became a star.

4787.name: Twisted Vines
4787.storyline: I loved the setting and the story setup. The plot was fun and unpredictable. The acting was spectacular and the entire mood was like a old Agatha Christie movie but new. Very entertaining. I highly recommend "Twisted Vines." Vivica Fox captured her character beautifully, and she was surrounded with a talented team of actors. The winery itself became another character in the film. The fire trapping them together added to the thrills, as did the nighttime filming. Everyone was truly believable and the twists and turns in the plot had me fooled until the end. I had read professional movie reviews before I saw it -- their high ratings were justly deserved. Great job all!

4788.name: Ordinary Days
4788.storyline: Ordinary Days (2017) is a 2017 Canadian dramatic thriller film. Directed by Kris Booth, Renuka Jeyapalan and Jordan Canning, the film centers on the mysterious disappearance of Cara Cook (Jacqueline Byers), telling the story from three different perspectives.Canning directs the first segment, which centers on Cara's parents Rich (Richard Clarkin) and Marie (Torri Higginson); Booth directs the second segment centering on Jonathan Brightbill (Michael Xavier), the police officer investigating Cara's disappearance; Jeyapalan directs the third, which reveals the story from Cara's own perspective. The cast also includes Joris Jarsky, Jefferson Brown and Daniel Kash.

4790.name: Ruin Me
4790.storyline: Features Eva Hamilton's first nude scene.

4791.name: The Circle
4791.storyline: Nicolaus and Mona Moonbeam (Mona Månstråle), two supporting characters in the book series, are not featured in the film. Scenes featuring Mona where shot, but discarded from the final film.

4792.name: Linkeroever
4792.storyline: First chapter of Pieter Van Hees's trilogy 'Anatomy of Love and Pain'. Was followed by Dirty Mind (2009) and Waste Land (2014).

4794.name: Kakegurui
4794.storyline: Miki Yanagi (who plays Midari Ikishima) and Haruka Fukuhara (who plays Jueri Arukibi) were co-stars in the 2017 mini series "Futari Monologue"

4795.name: Firecracker

4797.storyline: Followed by Rascal Does Not Dream of Santa Claus (2025)
